official duties and the person in whose name the meter or permit is issued shall be held responsible for such acts  performance of electrical work except as may be otherwise provided hereinafter no person shall do electrical work unless such person is either a licensee or registrant as herein provided or an officer employee or partner of such licensee or registrant acting within the course and scope of his employment with such licensee or registrant all work done by a registrant shall be supervised by the licensee named in the registration k inspections subject to constitutional limitations inspections reinspections or test of the electrical equipment contained therein or its installation b dangerous or unsafe conditions when the installation of any electrical conductors or electrical equipment is found to be in a dangerous or unsafe condition the owner or person using or operating same shall be notified in writing by the planning and urban development director and shall cause such equipment to be repaired or replaced in such a manner as to place such equipment in a safe condition and in compliance with this the time specified in such notice  civil liability nothing in this caused by any defect therein nor shall the city be held as assuming any such liability by reason of inspection or reinspection authorized herein or certificate of approval issued or by reason of installations which are dangerous or unsafe if the dangerous or unsafe condition has not been corrected within the time limits established by the director b in case of emergency where necessary for the safety or protection of persons or of property the director shall have the authority to immediately disconnect or cause the immediate disconnection of any electrical equipment in cases of representative of the director have the authority to cause the immediate disconnection of such electrical equipment and said electrical equipment shall not again be energized until same has been cabinets and equipment any official notice or seal to prevent the use of electricity  removing obstructions to inspections the planning and urban development director shall have the authority to remove or compel the removal of any obstruction or hindrance which may interfere with render inaccessible or prevent a full and complete inspection of any electrical equipment c hindering enforcement of such appeal the board shall within five 5 days proceed to hear the appeal and determine whether the action of the director complies with this chapter and within five 5 days from the date of the review shall render a decision in accordance with its findings h secs 14301440  reserved division 2  city electrical board created there is hereby created a city electrical board a members a the city electrical board shall consist of 1 the planning and urban development director or his designee 2 one employee from the company which furnishes electricity to the city 3 one electrical contractor licensed in the city 4 one person who is thoroughly familiar with the electrical business in both manufacture and engineering and who is a legal resident of the city and is not employed by another board member 5 one electrical sign manufacturer licensed in the city all members shall be appointed for terms of one years duration subject to the pleasure of the council b the members of the city electrical board shall serve without compensation a b c chairman the planning and urban development director or his designee shall serve as chairman of the city electrical board a meetings a majority of the members of the city electrical board present at a meeting shall constitute a quorum and any action taken shall be as binding as if all members were present the city electrical board shall meet when called by the chairman of same or by a majority of its members c d records a minute book shall be kept in which shall be recorded all business and transactions of the city electrical board i unlawful for any person to install or remove any electrical equipment or to make any alteration in or addition to any existing electrical conductors or equipment within or on any building structure or premises covered by this chapter without first securing a permit from the planning and urban development director  provided however that emergency work may be performed by an electrical contractor without a permit if an application for permit and inspection is filed with the director within twentyfour 24 hours after the work is started sundays and holidays excepted b on installations where more than one electrical contractor andor electrical sign manufacturer is involved each contractor shall apply for and secure a permit for the work performed by him  1212h permit application a before proceeding with any work for which a permit is required by the provisions of this chapter the electrical contractor or electrical sign manufacturer in charge of such proposed work shall first file with the planning and urban development director an application requesting a permit and inspection for such proposed work b application for permit and inspection shall be made in writing by the person that is to perform such work and shall state the exact street number of the premises on which the work is to be done name of owner or occupant name of mechanic or mechanics or supervisor to be in charge of proposed work a description of the work and the class of wiring c on all applications where plans and specifications require installation above the minimum requirements as set forth in this chapter the plans and specifications shall accompany the application for inspection and shall be available for use by the director at all times no deviation may be made in the installation described in such plans and specifications without written approval of the owner or architect ac temporary permits on repair work alterations or additions to existing installations where it is impossible to determine the exact amount of work to be performed the electrical contractor andor the electrical sign manufacturer shall make application to the planning and urban development director for a temporary permit such permit shall give all information required for an electrical permit except that it shall state an indefinite amount of work because of the nature thereof such application shall be accompanied with the minimum fee as herein provided before final approval of the work performed the contractor shall apply for a regular permit to replace the temporary permit and shall pay the difference between the amount paid for the temporary permit and the cost of the regular permit such application shall be accompanied with the minimum fee as hereinafter provided before final approval of the work performed the contractor shall apply for a regular permit to replace the temporary permit and shall pay the difference between the amount paid with the temporary application and the amount computed for the permanent permit such temporary permit shall be valid for thirty 30 days from issuance thereof unless renewed and upon expiration of same all fees accrued against same shall be due and payable should the work be stopped or terminated before completion the permanent permit shall be issued to cover the actual work performed and such fees due should the work be later reopened a like procedure shall be followed g inspections a electrical contractors andor electrical sign manufacturers shall at all times keep the planning and urban development director informed as to the progress of their work and shall request inspections as the work progresses requests for inspections shall be made by the contractor at such times as shall enable the director to inspect all phases of the work b when electrical equipment is to be hidden from view by the permanent placement of parts of the building or other equipment the planning and urban development director shall be notified by the contractor and no person shall conceal or cause to be concealed such electrical equipment until it has been inspected approved or authorized by the director or until twentyfour 24 hours exclusive of saturdays sundays and holidays shall have elapsed from the time of such notification  provided on large installations where the concealment of equipment proceeds continuously the person installing the electrical equipment shall give the director due notice and inspections shall be made periodically as the work progresses c the planning and urban development director shall have the authority to require building contractors to open such work which in any manner conceals electrical wiring that has been closed without its knowledge or permission and in no case shall the director issue a clearance or approval until satisfied that the work is in accord with the provisions of this chapter it shall be unlawful for any contractor or his representative to refuse to remove any construction that may hinder a full and complete inspection of electrical equipment when ordered to do so by the director d when electrical signs are constructed the sign manufacturer shall notify the planning and urban development director and the sign wiring and equipment shall not be concealed until it has been inspected approved or authorized or until after twentyfour 24 hours exclusive of saturdays sundays or holidays have elapsed from the time of such notification however approval of the underwriters laboratories inc evidenced by such label attached shall be deemed prima facie evidence to satisfy the requirements of this chapter and the director is authorized to approve such equipment without requiring further tests thereof e in cases of electrical signs manufactured outside of the city the electrical contractor or electrical sign manufacturer installing such sign shall at the time of issuance of permit for erection of same request inspection of same at the job site or any other location designated by the electrical inspector provided however the label of the underwriters laboratories inc attached to such equipment shall be deemed prima facie evidence to satisfy the requirements of this code and the planning and urban development director is authorized to approve such equipment without requiring further tests to be made thereof the serial number of such label shall accompany the municipal refuse collection service the city of monroe louisiana  definitions for the purposes of this article the following terms phrases words and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein litter is garbage refuse or rubbish as defined herein or as more fully defined in section 212 of this is the person which accumulates refuse within the limits of the city for the purposes hereof shopping centers office buildings and multifamily dwelling complexes shall be considered as single producers refuse is all putrescible and nonputrescible waste solid waste except body waste including garbage rubbish ashes street cleanings leaves grass cuttings dead animals and solid market and industrial waste 1     storage no producer shall place any refuse in any street alley boulevard or other public place or upon any private property whether owned by such producer or not within the city unless it be in proper containers for collection and approved by the public works director every residence or commercial business in the city which has applied for sewer or water service andor is actually doing business or where persons are residing in a residencebuilding owned or leased by such persons or is being leased by another shall have a container or other form of collection which is approved by the director of public works all commercialincluding apartment complexes shall place their garbage receptacles within the confines of their premises at locations to be approved by the department of public works and if necessary behind an enclosure the size to be determined by the public works director in conjunction with the city code enforcement division failure to get approval shall be a violation of this chapter subject to additional collection remedies listed in section 1620e 2     residential apartment and small business collections the following provisions shall be applicable to residential apartment and small business refuse collection 1 the person having authority to control the disposal of refuse collection in any household apartment or small business producing less than two 2 cubic yards of refuse per week shall cause all refuse garbage collection to be placed only in those receptacles supplied by the city 2 the city shall retain ownership of all containers which are provided for refuse garbage collection said containers shall not be removed from the premises in the event a user changes residence location he shall notify the city of such address change and the city will pick up the container from that location 3 any container or part thereof provided by the city which becomes lost or stolen shall be replaced by the city and shall be paid for by the users to which the container is assigned containers which are damaged fault of the city shall be replaced by the city and paid for by the user to which the container is assigned garbage pickup service will be suspended until such time a lost stolen or damaged container is replaced and paid for 4 it shall be the responsibility of the user to which a container is assigned to maintain his container in a clean healthy manner free of obnoxious odors maggots insect and rodents or in any other condition which may render them unhealthy to the environment or the neighborhood it shall further be the responsibility of the user to which a container is assigned to keep said container in good repair at all times 5 receptacles provided by the city shall be placed in the area between the sidewalk and the curb or in an accessible place as near to the street as possible containers shall not be placed at the curbside before  pm on the day prior to collection and shall be removed by nightfall on the day of collection containers shall also be placed at curbside on the street which the residence using the container fronts on if this regulation is not adhered to there will be no refuse pickup for that residence in violation hereof exceptions to the above requirements may be granted at the discretion of the public works director for persons with physical limitations which prevent placement of the garbage receptacles at the curb provided such exception is in writing and provided such exception is approved 6 users having containers or receptacles supplied with lid snaps must keep the lid snaps secured and in place at all times failure to adhere to this regulation will carry a fine of seven dollars and fifty cents $750 7 items of refuse that cannot be placed in receptacles provided by the city include poisons acids caustic explosives or other dangerous materials any type of construction materials paint paint thinner kerosene gasoline oil or oil filters in addition the following nonexclusive items shall not be placed for either trash or garbage collection under any circumstance furniture including mattresses any televisions stereos electrical appliances or plumbing fixtures 8 leaves and grass cuttings will be picked up by a separate and different truck such leaves and grass must be put in bagged containers and placed within six 6 feet of the pavement at the normal location for containers used in garbage pickup and never near a tree telephone pole signpost or other obstruction tree limbs shall be neatly stacked and shall not exceed four 4 feet in length or six 6 inches in diameter and each limb shall weigh no more than fifty 50 pounds all other yard waste including vines and small limbs shall be placed in bagged containers any items in violation of this section will not be collected by the city and will subject the violator to the additional collection fee set forth in subsection 1620e 9 the city will only pick up trees in residential and commercial areas in situations where they have fallen due to an act of disaster which endangers public health and welfare of the citys citizens violations of this section after one warning shall be punishable by a fine of not less than twentyfive dollars $2500 plus court costs said fine shall not be subject to suspension or probation warning by the public works department 10 any other violations of this subsection not carrying a specific fine mentioned above will subject the user of a container to a fine of fifteen dollars $1500 11 there shall be no dumping of any garbage or trash on any public rightofway median or boulevard any such violation shall subject the violator to in collectionnoncompliance fee charged herein or any other civil or criminal penalty allowed by law 3b       collection charges a there is hereby levied a service charge to defray the expense of the appropriateness as to the exterior architectural features has been submitted to and approved by the commission b if earthworks of historical or archaeological importance exist in any historical district there shall be no excavating or moving of earth rock or subsoil without a certificate of appropriateness from the commission c the style scale material size and location of outdoor advertising signs and billposters within historical districts shall be under the control of the commission d the commission shall consider interior arrangement or use but shall consider the relationship of the exterior of the buildings structures and edifices concerned with all others in the district to avoid incongruity and promote harmony therewith e the commission shall adhere to seek and compatibility of structures in the districts in terms of size texture scale and site plan f the provisions of this chapter shall not apply to repairs of damaged structures or buildings including fences or boundary walls which were damaged as a result of fire flood windstorm ice storm earthquake or other unforeseen cause the restoration must involve the use of similar construction materials the design and outward appearance must remain the same as it was before the damage event if design andor materials are different then such changes and action must be brought before the commission prior to initiating the action g demolition which has been ordered by the monroe city council or by a court of competent jurisdiction shall not require the approval of nor the issuance of a certificate from the commission  however the commission shall receive prior reasonable notice of condemnation proceedings pending before the council h the commission shall make no review approval certificates of appropriateness a the owner andor contractor prior to initiating any works described in subsections 1852a b or c shall submit an application for a certificate of appropriateness accompanied by reasonable plans and specifications of the work to the commission to the manner set forth in of this chapter b the commission shall hear and pass upon any application giving consideration to the factors set forth herein within thirty 30 days of the date it is received by the commission the commission shall report in writing to the building inspector within ten 10 days of the hearing and consideration of the application its recommendations on the permit application including such changes or modifications as may be reasonably necessary to comply with the requirements of this chapter the commission shall attach the application the application and all documents therewith to its report and recommendation evidence of the approval shall be in the form of a certificate of appropriateness a copy of the report and recommendation shall be promptly sent to the applicant failure to respond within the tenday period herein shall be deemed a recommendation of approval the commission shall keep a record of all applications for certificates of appropriateness and of all its actions under this chapter c no building or demolition permit shall be issued by the building inspector who affects a site or structure in any historic district without a certificate of appropriateness except as otherwise permitted by subsections 1852f and g  state law reference certificates of appropriateness rs  samecriteria the criteria to be used by the commission in making recommendations shall be as follows 1 to the extend that is economically feasible efforts to provide compatible uses of buildings requiring minimal building building site or environmental alterations shall be encouraged  2 removal destruction or alteration of original characteristics or unique architectural features or a building should be discouraged  3 in the rehabilitation of historic buildings the use of material matching or compatible with those already used on the building as to composition design color texture and other visible qualities shall be encouraged  4 contemporary design in new construction and in alterations and addition should not be discouraged when such alterations and additions do not destroy significant historical architectural or cultural material  5 demolition of a building or buildings of historical significance should be avoided if the commission can demonstrate that it is economically feasible to preserve the building  6 the provisions of this chapter shall apply to all private property in the districts established herein including all buildings structures areas sites and their adjuncts and appurtenances and insofar as they constitute part of the entirety or tout ensemble of the historic district  and 7 the provisions of this chapter shall not apply to buildings structures areas sites public ways or property including any adjuncts or appurtenances thereto owned under the custody of or under the responsibility of any governmental agency of local state or federal government within the historic district however any such agency shall seek the advice of the commission prior to initiating any substantial change modification renovation restoration commission  purpose the purpose of the commission shall be to promote the educational cultural economical and general welfare of the public by the preservation of the buildings monuments structures sites and area of historic interest or importance  to promote and improve property values  and to foster the economic development of the areas affected  recommendation and appointment of members the adoption of technical codes by reference  215 state law reference adoption by reference rs  et seq penalties anyone who is found guilty of violating the provisions of this chapter including the provisions of the southern standard housing adopted herein shall be fined not less than seventyfive dollars $7500 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 per offense each day that a violation is permitted to exist shall constitute a separate offense  landscaping requirements intent the intent of the landscaping requirements stated herein are as follows a to aid in stabilizing the environments ecological balance by contribution to the processes of air movement air purification oxygen regeneration groundwater recharge and stormwater runoff control  while at the same time aiding in noise glare heat and dust abatement  b to provide visual buffering between land uses of differing character  c to enhance the beautification and quality of life of the metropolitan area  d to protect the public health safety and general welfare  e to safeguard and enhance property values and to protect public and private investment  f to assist in providing adequate light and air and in preventing overcrowding of land  g to encourage innovation and quality in landscape and architectural design  and h to enhance the pedestrian character of the city streetscape  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this division shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning buffer planting area the unpaved area of land located between the property line and building or vehicular use area designated for the preservation and placement of plant materials caliper the diameter of a tree trunk measured six 6 inches above ground level if a tree is of a multitrunk variety the caliper of the tree is the average caliper of all its trunks canopy tree a species of a tree which normally bears crown foliage no lower than six 6 feet above ground level upon maturity ground cover natural mulch or plants of species which normally reach a height of less than three 3 feet upon maturity installed in such a manner so as to form a continuous cover over the ground large tree a tree of a species which normally reaches a height of thirty 30 feet or more upon maturity nonpermeable coverage coverage with nonpermeable pavement or any surface lacking the ability for air and water to pass the root zone of plants permeable coverage any surface with the ability for air and water to pass the root zone of plants sight safety triangle the triangle at either side of an accessway or public rightofway with sides of a specific length each along the public rightofway andor accessway refer to section 1957c for specific lengths small tree a tree of a species which normally reaches a height of less than thirty 30 feet upon maturity temporary certificate of occupancy this certificate allows for a structure to be used and occupied for a specified time period until a certificate of occupancy is officially approved visibility at intersections on a corner building site in any district in which a front yard is required no fence wall hedge or other structure or plant more than three 3 feet in height shall be erected placed or maintained within the triangular area formed by the intersecting street rightsofway property lines and a straight line connecting such street rightsofway property lines at point twenty 20 feet from the point of intersection measured along such street rightsofway property lines  administration a the provisions of this chapter shall apply to any real property having street frontage with zoning classifications designated by the monroe planning commission which involve any new construction of commercial governmental industrial multifamily of three 3 or more units religious educational and conditional uses as deemed necessary and appropriate by the monroe planning commission b singlefamily and twofamily residences shall be exempt from these requirements c the requirements of this chapter shall not apply to the development of lots on property subdivided before landscaping came into effect where the minimum requirements of this chapter cannot be met due to property size or configuration the unbuilt site area must be fully utilized if possible for landscape purposes to satisfy the intent of this chapter    existing developed areas a unless otherwise noted all property designated in section 1953 with existing paved ground surface areas on the effective date of this ordinance shall not be required to conform with the requirements of this chapter unless construction or expansion of improvements on the property requiring a building permit is undertaken that 1 increases the number of stories in a building on the property  2 increases by more than twenty 20 per cent or twenty thousand 20000 square feet whichever is less the combined floor areas of all buildings on the property  or 3 increases the nonpermeable coverage on the property by more than three thousand 3000 square feet or ten 10 parking spaces b no structure shall be required to be altered or moved except during construction to meet the requirements of this chapter c existing developed areas designated section 1953 which are not undergoing construction or expansion activities are encouraged although not legally obligated to meet the landscaping requirements as stated in this chapter  landscape plan submission a landscape plan must be submitted in conjunction with the required site plan to the planning and zoning division or the monroe planning commission with the application for a building permit for work on the property in addition a landscape plan must be submitted as part of the required site plan review by the monroe planning commission the landscape plan can either be a separate print or be included on the required site plan print the minimum information required on the landscape plan shall include a locations and dimensions of the proposed landscaping strips adjacent to the public rightofway including a description and location of the trees and plant materials to be placed within the landscaping strip  b locations and dimensions of the proposed landscape areas within the parking area including a description and location of the trees and plant materials to be placed within the landscape areas  c locations and calipers of existing healthy trees to be retained and counted as part of the landscaping requirements  d an indication of how existing healthy trees proposed to be retained will be protected from damage during construction  and e compliance with visibility at intersections requirements    alternative compliance a landscape plan which is alternative to strict compliance with the various landscaping requirements of this chapter may be reviewed by the planning and zoning division and approved by the monroe city council if this plan achieves the intent and general landscaped open space ratio of this chapter  street frontage requirements a for all land under the jurisdiction of this section there shall be a minimum of a fivefoot landscaping strip abutting the public rightofway running parallel with the street line exclusive of driveways and access ways at points of ingress and egress to and from the property where the acreage falls within twenty 20 and fifty 50 acres a tenfoot landscaping strip shall be required where the acreage exceeds fifty 50 acres a fifteenfoot landscaping strip shall be required b the minimum width of a nonresidential accessway to an offstreet parking or other vehicular use area shall be twenty 20 feet for twoway vehicular movement and twelve 12 feet for oneway movement the maximum width for an accessway shall be thirty 30 feet for twoway vehicular movement except along major traffic routes of which the maximum width shall be thirtyfive 35 feet and twentyfour 24 feet for oneway movement the minimum width of a multifamily residential accessway shall be fifteen 15 feet and the maximum width shall be twentyfour 24 feet for street frontage up to seventyfive 75 feet no more than two 2 oneway or one twoway accessways will be permitted for each additional seventyfive 75 feet of frontage two 2 additional oneway or one additional twoway accessways may be permitted c the line of sight safety triangle at either side of an accessway intersecting with a public street shall be not less than ten 10 feet in length along the accessway and public street rightofway the line of sight safety triangle at the junction of two 2 public streets shall be not less than twenty 20 along each public street rightofway this line of sight safety triangle must be essentially clear of obstructions above the height of three 3 feet above grade to allow for vehicular visibility d landscaping shall consist of a combination of plant materials from each of the following categories 1 grassesground coversvines 2 shrubshedges 3 trees grasses and ground covers alone shall not constitute adequate landscaping e there shall be at least one large tree for every sixty 60 lineal feet of the required landscaping strip or one small tree for every thirty 30 lineal feet of the required landscaping strip f as part of the trees required any existing tree with a twelveinch or greater caliper that is retained within the required front yard as defined by zoning ordinances or landscape strip shall be counted as two 2 trees in satisfying the above requirement g the requirements for trees in the front yard shall be waived on a treefortree basis if the adjacent public rightofway excluding medians contains existing street trees h landscaping the adjacent rightofway shall be permitted subject to approval by the city engineer credit for up to fifty 50 per cent of the minimum street frontage landscaping area requirements shall be allotted for landscaping the public rightofway the preceding statement shall apply only to those areas where the fivefoot landscaping strip is required  offstreet surface parking facility requirements a in addition to the street frontage landscaping requirement a minimum of twenty 20 square feet of landscape area shall be provided for each required offstreet parking space such landscaping shall be located within the paved portion of the parking lot andor within twenty 20 feet immediately adjacent to the paved portion of the parking lot or any buffer area b landscaping shall consist of a combination of lawn grasses ground covers shrubs trees and nonliving durable material such as brick stone rocks pavers etc eighty 80 per cent of such material shall be living grasses and ground covers alone shall not constitute adequate landscaping c a minimum of one large or small tree for each twelve 12 required parking spaces shall be required in the offstreet parking area d these landscaped areas shall be to the extent possible evenly distributed to effectively relieve the monotony of large paved areas but not interfere with the orderly circulation of vehicular and pedestrian traffic location can be adjusted to accommodate existing trees or other natural features as long as the total offstreet parking area landscaping requirements are met e all landscaped areas except grass areas shall be protected from vehicular encroachment by concrete curbs wheel stops or other permanent barriers and should be raised f as part of the tree requirements any existing tree with a twelveinch or greater caliper that is retained within the parking lot shall be counted as two 2 trees in satisfying the above requirement subject to the following i if such existing trees later dies or is removed two 2 trees shall be required to be planted  and ii permeable coverage shall be maintained to the extent of the crown of the existing tree at the original elevation g a reduction of two 2 feet measured from the concrete curb or other permanent barrier shall be allowed in the computation of the depth of parking spaces contiguous to the perimeter landscaping strips andor interior planting area in such event this reduction shall not be considered as a reduction of the landscaped area h storage areas containing three 3 or more refuse garbage or rubbish containers or one or more dumpsters shall be screened on all sides with a sixfoot high seventy 70 per cent sight obscuring screen of living or one hundred 100 per cent sight obscuring screen of nonliving landscape material  acceptable landscape materials a large trees shall have a minimum caliper of two 2 inches or a minimum height of ten 10 feet at the time of planting depending on the standard measuring techniques for the species b small trees shall have a minimum height of six 6 feet at the time of planting c for the purposes of this section height is measured from the top of the root ball or if the plant is in a container from the soil level in the container d in satisfying the landscaping requirements of this division the use of high quality hardy and droughttolerant plant materials is recommended and encouraged  technical assistance the staff of the planning and zoning division will provide when applicable assistance to property owners in applying the requirements of this chapter to their respective site plans it is further recommended that property owners consult with landscape nurseries landscape architects architects engineers etc regarding the development of landscape plans and appropriate plant materials  installation and maintenance a tree limbs shrubs and other planting shall be installed and maintained in compliance with the monroe city b the property owner shall be responsible for watering and maintaining all installed landscaping in a healthy neat and orderly condition replacing plants and trees when necessary and keeping the area free of refuse and debris tree limbs and other planting shall be maintained so as not to create an obstruction to a drivers visibility andor pedestrian movement c ground covers including wildflowers which are used to satisfy the requirements of this division are not considered grasses and thus shall not be subject to the citys grass height limitation requirements  enforcement no certificate of occupancy shall be approved before completion of landscaping except as follows if due to the seasonal nature of plant materials landscaping has not been completed at the time that a certificate of occupancy could be granted and such certificate is requested the planning and zoning division may grant a temporary certificate of occupancy to the owner or his agent which will specify an eightmonth time limitation for completion of the landscaping requirements of this chapter any violation of this section shall result in a fine of one hundred dollars $10000 per day until completion of the approved landscaping all other violations of this chapter shall be subject to the general penalty levied there is hereby levied from and after  for the purposes stated in the proposition set forth in the preamble to the ordinance from which this article is derived a tax upon the sale at retail the use the lease or rental the consumption and storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services within the authority as defined herein  and the levy of such tax shall be as follows 1 at the rate of one and onehalf 15 per cent of the sales price of each item or article of tangible personal property when sold at retail in the authority the tax to be computed on gross sales for the purpose of remitting the amount of tax due the governing body and to include each and every retail sale 2 at the rate of one and onehalf 15 per cent of the cost price of each item or article of tangible personal property when the same is not sold but is used consumed distributed or stored for use or consumption in the authority provided there shall be no duplication of the tax 3 at the rate of one and onehalf 15 per cent of the gross proceeds derived from the lease or rental of tangible personal property as defined herein where the lease or rental of such property is an established business or part of an established business or the same is incidental or germane to the business 4 at the rate of one and onehalf 15 per cent of the monthly lease or rental price paid by lessee or rentee or contracted or agreed to be paid by lessee or rentee to the owner of the tangible personal property 5 at the rate of one and onehalf 15 per cent of the gross proceeds derived from the sale of services as defined herein a31  01 2883 special regulations relating to rental property sales or use taxes paid to this governing body on the purchase of new motor trucks and new motor item of property so that no tax is payable on rental income until the tax paid on the purchase price has been exceeded the sales tax paid to another authority or taxing authority in the state or in an payments if the tax on rental payments fails to exceed the credits for sales or use tax paid no refund is due the purchaser a dealer in the authority who ordinarily purchases personal property for  scope of tax it is not the intention of this article to levy a tax upon articles of tangible personal property imported into the authority or produced or manufactured in the authority for export  nor state of louisiana rs  et seq b the tax levied by this article on the use of any such vehicle in this authority shall be due at the time first registration in this authority is required by the vehicle registration license tax law rs  et seq 2 every vendor of such a vehicle shall furnish to the purchaser at the time of sale a sworn statement showing the serial number motor number type year and model of the vehicle sold the total sales price any allowance for and description of any vehicle taken in trade and the total cash difference paid or to be paid by the purchaser between the vehicle purchased and traded in and the sales or use tax to be paid along with such other information as may be required all labor parts accessories and other equipment which are attached to the vehicle at the time of the sale and which are included in the sale price are to be considered a part of the vehicle 3 it is not the intention of this section to grant an exemption from the tax levied by this article to any sale use item or transaction which has heretofore been taxable  and this section shall not be construed as so doing it is the intention of this section to transfer the collection of the sales and use tax on vehicles from the vendor to the vehicle commissioner as agent for the collector of revenue of the state and to provide a method of collection of the tax directly from the vendee or user by the vehicle commissioner as agent for the collector of revenue in accordance with an agreement by and between the collector of revenue or the vehicle commissioner as agent therefor and the governing body the execution of which agreement is hereby authorized said tax so collected for the collector of revenue shall be paid to the governing body and sent to the collector as soon as possible and in any event at least once each month all in accordance with the agreement 4 the provision contained in section 2058 of this excludes isolated or occasional sales from the definition of a sale at retail is not to apply to the sale of vehicles which are the subject of this section isolated or occasional sales of vehicles are hereby defined to be sales at retail and as such are subject to the tax 5 the tax levied by this article shall not be due on vehicles furnished by a dealer in new vehicles when withdrawn from inventory and furnished to a secondary school college or public school board on a free loan basis for exclusive use in a driver education program accredited by the louisiana department of education a51  06 2883 offering to absorb tax prohibited  tax to be stated from being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street sidewalk or other public place or upon private property  sweeping or blowing litter into gutters prohibited except when authorized by a any person who drops or permits to be dropped or thrown upon any highway or upon any other public or private property without the consent of the owner thereof or into or on any waters of this city from a vehicle any waste paper sweepings ashes household waste glass metal refuse or rubbish or any dangerous or detrimental substance shall immediately remove the same or cause it to be removed b whenever any litter is thrown or discarded or allowed to fall from a vehicle or boat in violation of this chapter the operator or owner or both of the motor vehicle or boat shall also be deemed to have violated this chapter c for the purposes of this section a person who permits to be dropped or thrown from a vehicle any of the items described in subsection a shall include the driver of the vehicle and the registrant of any vehicle lawfully registered from which any of the items are dropped or thrown either by the registrant or any person operating in possession of or present within the vehicle with the permission of the registrant regardless of the registrants intent or lack of knowledge with respect to the disposal of such items in violation of this section where the registrant of the vehicle does not with reasonable certainty identify the driver of the vehicle at the time the violation occurred  truck loads causing litter no person shall drive or move any truck or other lands or waters of the city  uncovered vehicles it shall be unlawful for any person engaged in commercial or forhire hauling to operate any truck or other vehicle within this city to transport merchandise litter trash or garbage unless the vehicle is covered to prevent its contents from blowing dropping fall off or otherwise departing from the vehicle in addition any person operating his own truck or other vehicle to transport merchandise litter trash or garbage shall take reasonable steps to prevent its contents from blowing dropping fall off otherwise departing from the vehicle  discarding certain items prohibited it shall be unlawful for any person to place or cause to be placed any junk motor vehicle old vehicle tire or inoperative or abandoned household appliance or part thereof upon the rightofway of any public highway upon any other public or private property which he or she does not own lease rent or otherwise control unless it is at a permitted salvage yard a permitted disposal site or at the business establishment of a demolisher deposit of the aforementioned items on the owners private property is also prohibited if they become a threat to the aesthetics safety or public health of the community or become a public nuisance  litter in parks no person shall throw or deposit litter in any park within the city except in public receptacles and in such a manner that the litter will be prevented from being carried or deposited by the elements upon any part of the park or upon any street or other public place where public receptacles are not provided all such litter shall be carried away from the park by the person responsible for its presence and properly disposed of elsewhere as provided herein  litter in bodies of water no person shall throw or deposit litter in any fountain pond stream or any other body of water in a park or elsewhere within the city  litter on occupied private property no person shall throw or deposit litter on any occupied private property within the city whether owned by such person or not except that the owner or person in control of private property may maintain authorized private receptacles for collection in such a manner that litter will be prevented from being carried or deposited by the elements upon any street sidewalk or other public place or upon any private property  owner to maintain premises free of litter the owner or person in control of any private property shall at all times maintain the premises free of litter provided however that this section shall not prohibit the storage of litter in authorized private receptacles for collection  litter on vacant lots no person shall throw or deposit litter on any open or vacant private property within the city whether owned by such person or not  posters and temporary signs a it is hereby declared unlawful for any person to drive any nails or tacks into utility poles trees fences sign columns or building walls b campaign posters and other temporary notices or signs placed in rightsofway alleys servitudes on streets or other public property whether freestanding or attached to existing structures shall be considered litter  prima facie evidence against drivers if the throwing dumping or depositing of litter was done from a motor vehicle except a motor bus it shall be prima facie evidence that the throwing dumping or depositing was done by the driver of the motor vehicle  prima facie evidence against violator if the litter discarded can be identified with a persons name it shall be prima facie evidence that the throwing dumping or depositing was done by the person whose name appears on the litter  rental property a landlord shall be responsible for any violation occurring at his rental property even when it is caused by his tenants  notice the city may erect signs containing pertinent portions of this chapter along its public highways in parks recreational areas and at other places where persons are to be informed of the existence and content of this law and the penalties for violating its provisions  enforcement this chapter shall be enforced by the city attorneys office the code enforcement division the monroe police department the public works department the beautification division and the monroe city court the named enforcement officers are empowered to issue citations to or if authorized to arrest persons violating any provisions of this chapter all enforcement officers who are duly authorized shall serve and execute all warrants citations and other process issued by the courts in enforcing the provisions of this chapter in addition mailing by certified mail of such process to an alleged violators last place of residence shall be deemed as personal service upon the person charged  disposition of litter citations a the original litter citation shall be signed by the issuing officer or other duly qualified agent of the city and shall be processed in accordance with this chapter and such other procedures as may be established and promulgated by the city of monroe b a litter citation may be dismissed by the city attorney or his designee only upon his written statement for good cause shown which statement shall be made a part of the disposition record thereof  citation as legal demand and prima facie evidence the original litter citation or any true copy thereof shall constitute an ordinary business record of the city and prima facie evidence of the facts contained therein  answering litter citation  failure to answer a a person to whom a litter citation has been issued under this chapter may answer to the same in the manner and within the delays indicated on the citation an answer may take the form of 1 admission of the violation with payment of the scheduled penalty  or 2 request for administrative review  or 3 appeal of administrative review findings b if the owner his agent or the operator fails to appear on or prior to the court date there shall be assessed additional delinquent penalties as provided in this chapter  failure to pay  civil action whenever a person charged with a litter violation fails to pay his penalty the city attorney or his designee may file a civil action against the accused violator in the monroe city court service of process and all other civil procedures and delays shall be followed as in other civil matters before the monroe city court  response to citation the person to whom a litter citation has been issued for a violation of this chapter shall discharge the summons within ten 10 days after the time such notice was issued by delivering or mailing the appropriate sum to the city of monroes tax and revenue division at 316 breard street or at post office box 123 monroe louisiana 71210 such payment may be made by cash money order or personal business or cashiers checks or credit cards and made payable to the city of monroe payment of the penalty established herein shall operate as a final disposition of the case  citation challenges a administrative review generally 1 if the alleged violator wishes to challenge the issued citation he should request an administrative review which is conducted by the city attorney or his designee who is wellversed in the city of monroe litter request must be made within three 3 days of receipt of the citation the purpose of this step is to screen out those citations where the alleged violator is clearly not liable for the citation 2 if administrative review is requested the alleged violator will be required to post the penalty amount of his citation and a nonrefundable ten dollar $1000 processing fee prior to being scheduled for review he must submit a written declaration to the city attorney or his designee request for administrative review forms will be available at the city of monroes division the form must be completed and returned along with a copy of the citation and any other applicable proof to the office of the city attorney civil division at post office box 123 monroe louisiana 71210 any documentation submitted with the administrative review request form will not be returned nor will copies be provided for the requestor 3 a selfaddressed stamped envelope must also be included for notification of the finding of the review an accused violator will be notified in writing of the findings of the review 4 if the alleged violator is found not liable then his penalty funds will be refunded if the citation is upheld the alleged violator may appeal the findings of the review to the monroe city court if he chooses not to appeal then the penalty amount previously posted will be forfeited 5 a litter citation may be dismissed if it is determined after review it was either factually incorrect or issued in error b appeal 1 the final step in the challenge process is an appeal to the civil division of the monroe city court the appeal must be filed at least five 5 days after the findings of the administrative review are completed 2 the appellant will be responsible for paying any necessary filing fees for the appeal hearing if he prevails his posted penalty amount will be refunded if the citation is upheld the litter penalty will be forfeited 3 litter penalties are to be remitted to the city of monroes taxation and revenue division  failure to respond to citation a any person guilty of violating the provisions of this chapter unless otherwise stated shall be subject to a fine of one hundred dollars $10000 if paid within ten 10 days from the date of receipt of the citation however any person guilty of violating the provisions of this section more than once in any day shall be subject to a fine of one hundred dollars $10000 for each violation if paid within ten 10 days b if said fines isare not paid within ten 10 days then each violation will result in a fine of two hundred fifty dollars $25000 this amount shall be paid within twenty 20 days from the date of receipt of the citation c upon the lapse of twenty 20 days and if payment has not been received by the city a certified letter will be mailed to the person in violation notifying said person of a fine increase of five hundred dollars $50000 for each violation d if the person fails to pay the amount due or fails to appear in court on or before the scheduled court date a default judgment may be entered both for the sanction amount and any additional fees including any imposed collection fees  judgment a court finding of a litter violation is the same as a personal judgment  therefore the court can issue garnishments to collect fines and costs b a person against whom a judgment has been rendered may be directed by the court to pick up and remove litter from public property or private property or both with prior permission of the legal owner if the person has no other judgments against him for violation of this chapter he may be ordered to pick up and remove litter for not less than eight 8 hours but not for more than sixteen 16 hours upon the rendering of a second judgment the person may be ordered to pick up and remove litter for not less than sixteen 16 hours and not more than thirtytwo 32 hours upon the third and subsequent judgments against said person he may be ordered to pick up and remove litter for not less than forty 40 hours and not more than eighty 80 hours the court shall schedule the time to be spent on such activities in such a manner that it does not interfere with the persons employment and does not interfere substantially with the persons family responsibilities or religious obligations c the court should also consider the persons infirmity if any or age or other circumstance which would create a hardship penalties for violations a whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall 1 upon first conviction be fined two hundred fifty dollars $25000 and sentenced to serve eight 8 hours of community service in a litter abatement work program as approved by the court 2 upon second conviction be fined five hundred dollars $50000 and sentenced to serve sixteen 16 hours of community service in a litter abatement work program as approved by the court 3 upon third or subsequent conviction be fined one thousand two hundred fifty dollars $125000 have his motor vehicle drivers license suspended for one year and be sentenced to serve eighty 80 hours of community service in a litter abatement work program as approved by the court or all or any combination of the penalties provided by this chapter b whoever violates the provisions of this chapter shall pay special court costs of one hundred dollars $10000 in lieu of other costs of court and the special court costs shall be disbursed as follows 1 twenty dollars $2000 shall be paid to the judicial expense fund for the monroe city court 2 twenty dollars $2000 shall be paid to the office of the city prosecutor 3 ten dollars $1000 shall be paid to the clerk of the monroe city court 4 twentyfive dollars $2500 shall be paid to the keep monroe beautiful inc fund 5 twentyfive dollars $2500 shall be paid to the law enforcement agency that issued the citation  citation the person shall be cited for the offense by means of a citation summons or other means provided by law  liability a person may be found guilty or held liable and fined under this chapter although the commission of the offense did not occur in the presence of a law enforcement officer if the evidence presented to the court establishes that the defendant has committed the offense  occurrence for the purposes of this section each occurrence shall constitute a separate violation  additional penalties in addition to penalties otherwise provided a person convicted or held liable under this chapter shall 1 repair or restore property damaged by or pay damages for any damage arising out of the violation of this chapter 2 pay all reasonable investigative expenses and costs to the investigative agency or agencies  exemptions notwithstanding any provision to the contrary this chapter shall not apply to any activity by persons owning or operating duly licensed commercial vehicles engaged in the collection and transportation of solid waste construction or demolition debris or wood waste as such terms are defined by the rules and regulations of the department of environmental quality occurring in the course of servicing scheduled pickup routes pursuant to commercial or local government contracts or en route to an authorized pickup station transfer station or disposal facility  burden of proof in the criminal trial of a person charged with violating this chapter the alleged violator has the burden of proving that he had the right or authority to dump the litter for which he has been cited  record of violations it shall be the duty of the city of monroe division to keep account of all violations of the litter regulations contained in this chapter there shall be shared efforts among the division the monroe police department the public works department and the beautification division of the city to ensure the accuracy of the records of litter violations  adoptaspot program a the adoptaspot program which has grown out of the keep america beautiful organization of the 1950s may be implemented in the city as a leadership opportunity to systematically invite and recognize volunteers for helping the city enhance and maintain its natural beauty and cleanliness b the mayor or his designee is authorized to establish administer and promote an adoptaspot program which is promoted by keep monroe beautiful inc whereby businesses and civic organizations agree to maintain certain designated city streets intersections or designated locations in the city by removing litter cutting weeds or similar activity for a designated time and under certain standards of participation to provide for limitations on andor waiver of liability in favor of the city its employees agencies and contractors and otherwise providing for the establishment operation and promotion of such voluntary program  severability if any section subsection sentence clause phrase or portion of this chapter is for any reason held invalid or unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction such portion shall be deemed a separate distinct and independent provision and such holding shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions hereof  marshals office footnotes  1  cross reference police ch 28 article i  in general secs 215121525  reserved article ii  personnel footnotes  2  cross reference personnel system app a incentive pay program a the program herewith established shall be known as the city marshal incentive pay program b the objective of the incentive pay program herein established is to raise the educational level of the officers of the city marshals office in order to assure the continuance of a modern efficient and effective office c all officers now or hereafter serving on active duty with and as regular fulltime employees of the city marshals office shall be eligible to participate in this program personnel employed primarily to perform purely clerical or nonenforcement duties including but not necessarily restricted to the following types of duties or persons secretaries filing clerks office machine operators switchboard operators stenographers and similar employees of the office shall not be eligible to participate in this program d the new incentive pay program shall commence  this program shall include all current and new eligible employees of the office subsequent to its enactment and shall thereafter progress in annual increments upon each anniversary of the employees employment with the office as follows 1 upon his employment with the eligible office an employee with one 1 year of college credits thirtytwo 32 semester hours or more in an approved curriculum shall be paid fifty dollars $5000 per month above his base pay 2 upon the first anniversary of his employment with the office an eligible employee with two 2 years of college credits sixtyfour 64 semester hours or more in an approved curriculum shall be paid one hundred dollars $10000 per month above his base pay 3 upon the second anniversary of his employment with the office an eligible employee with a bachelors degree in an approved curriculum shall be paid one hundred fifty dollars $15000 per month above his base pay 4 upon the third anniversary of his employment with the office an eligible employee with a masters degree in an approved curriculum shall be paid two hundred dollars $20000 per month above his base pay no eligible employee shall be paid more than one 1 of the above categories of incentive pay at the same time all eligible employees who are education home economics library science pharmacy medical technology music and nursing however upon petition of an officer the city marshal is hereby empowered to waive this requirement and allow credit for purposes of this program for one 1 or more courses in the above curriculums g college incentive pay shall be considered for the purposes of calculating pension and relief benefits fund h the city marshals office is hereby empowered to promulgate such rules as he may deem advisable to provide for proper administration of the city marshals office incentive pay program so long as such rules do not conflict with the provisions of this section such rules may include but shall not be limited to provisions concerning what colleges shall be deemed accredited for purposes of this program what college credits shall be accepted for purposes of this program what courses shall be andor shall not be accepted for purposes of this program i in the event any question should arise as to the interpretation of any provision of this section or of any rule promulgated under the authority of this section the decision of the city attorney as to the correct interpretation thereof shall to the point of beginning containing a gross area of 70975 acres more or less less and except that certain 1296 acre tract or parcel of land conveyed to the ouachita parish school board from the united states of america as described in conveyance book 428  of the records of ouachita parish louisiana and being shown on the survey of the monroe industrial park filed in plat book 15  of the records of ouachita parish louisiana leaving a net area of 69679 acres in the monroe airindustrial park  scope the real property known as the monroe airindustrial park which is and shall be occupied subject to the conditions covenants restrictions reservations and easements set forth herein in this article  purpose the monroe airindustrial park shall be developed with the intentions and goals of fostering economic development increasing public revenues providing a positive environment for job creation and improving the general quality of life for citizens in the monroe and surrounding area and in particular 1 to encourage the future growth and expansion of existing commercial and industrial ventures within the northeast louisiana region  2 to attract and secure the relocation of new enterprise to the area and encourage private investment in the monroe airindustrial park  and 3 to generate provide for and sustain an increased number of quality and stable jobs the park is subjected to the conditions covenants restrictions reservations and easements herein declared 1 to insure proper use and appropriate development and improvement of each building site thereof  2 to protect the ownersoccupants of building sites against such improper use of surrounding building sites as will depreciate the value of their property  3 to guard against the erection thereon of structures built of improper or unsuitable materials  4 to insure adequate and reasonable development of said property  5 to encourage the erection of attractive improvements thereon with appropriate locations thereof on building sites  6 to prevent haphazard and inharmonious improvements of building sites  7 to secure and maintain proper setbacks from streets and adequate open spaces between structures  and 8 in general to provide adequately for a high type and quality of improvement on said property  use of property 1 except as hereinafter expressly permitted the building sites within the park shall be used for commercial office space retail food and beverage hospitality industrial manufacturing fabricating warehousing or distribution purposes with related administrative offices as secondary use associated with another primary permitted use  and 2 building sites within the park shall be used for any business devoted primarily to the retail sale of consumertype merchandise or services that have been expressly approved and authorized by the advisory board and provided further that the retail sale of food beverage and other convenience items are offered for sale to the general public as long as they have been expressly approved and authorized by the advisory board 3 no industry or other business shall be established maintained or permitted on any building site within the park which produces objectionable smoke dust noise light odor vibration or electrical disturbance or interference determination of whether an industry or business is objectionable for any of these reasons shall be at the discretion of the advisory board 4 no building site within the park shall be used for the manufacture storage distribution or sale of any materials or products which shall increase the insurance rates of the adjoining property or for any purpose which constitutes a nuisance under the law of the state of louisiana 5 no building site within the park shall be used for the discharge storage or burial of any liquid solid waste or airborne particulate matter defined as hazardous by federal state parish or local law 6 no building site within the park shall be used for the drilling for andor removal of oil gas or other subterranean substances  the operation of junkyards  the dumping disposal incineration or reduction of garbage sewage offal or dead animals  the smelting of ores  the refining or storage of petroleum products or other highly combustible materials  the manufacture or storage of explosives the manufacture of acid  the manufacture of fertilizer    fines for noncompliance noncompliance with any and all parts of this ordinance will result in fines of not less than five hundred dollars $50000 and no less than twentyfive 25 hours of community service recommendations of which will be made by the advisory board  secs 2262215  reserved article ii  the advisory board the advisory board established  appointments the advisory board for the monroe development the master plan for development 4 the board shall make recommendations to the mayor and city council on any decisions which directly or indirectly affect the short and long term planning committees or park occupant committees as may be required  secs 22202230  reserved article iii  sales and lease policy policy on commission for realtors as brokers any real estate broker licensed to conduct business within the state of louisiana broker shall be eligible for a sales commission not to exceed seven 7 per cent computed on the gross purchase price for lands sold in the monroe airindustrial park located in ouachita parish louisiana subject to the following terms and conditions 1 broker shall represent either the seller city of monroe or the buyer and must register the prospect buyer with the city by forwarding a letter from the prospect addressed to the city attorney outlining and confirming the brokers participation with said prospect to receive commission broker and buyer must not be one in the same all prospect names will be kept in confidence 2 a preliminary proposal for development of the property must first be reviewed and approved by the advisory board according to requirements set forth in section 2232 before the sale is completed to assure confidentiality the name of the prospect need not appear on the proposal 3 the city shall approve all city will remain registered unless the prospect notifies the city attorney in writing that the broker no longer represents said prospect  preliminary proposal prior to the sale or lease of any property within the monroe airindustrial park a preliminary proposal for development must be submitted to the monroe airindustrial park advisory board po box 123 monroe louisiana 71210 preliminary classifications the general wage scale and skill levels required 3 building type and square footage of the planned facility 4 the specific use of the property 5 a graphic conceptual site plan and any anticipated facility or employment changes  sales 1 the advisory board must recommend the sale of the property and it must be approved by city council all sales shall be subject to the covenants proposal for development it is to be sold back to the city and the purchase price paid by the city will be equal to seventyfive 75 per cent of the original purchase price 3 all option contracts shall definitions as used in this article the following terms shall have the meanings ascribed to them below accessory structure shall mean a detached subordinate building located on the same building site with the main building the use of which is incidental to that of the main building board shall mean the monroe airindustrial park advisory board building setback line or lines shall mean the minimum distance which commercial or industrial buildings and accessory structures or any structures of any type or kind located above ground shall be set back from the property lines building site shall mean any lot or portion thereof or two 2 or more contiguous lots or portions thereof or a parcel of land upon which a commercial or industrial building or buildings and appurtenant structures may be erected in conformance with the requirements of these covenants grantor shall mean the city of monroe louisiana its successors and assigns unless the contract indicates otherwise improvements shall mean and include a commercial or industrial building or buildings accessory structures appurtenant thereto parking areas driveways loading areas service areas fences masonry walls hedges lawns mass plantings and other landscaping site excavation signage transmission tower and any structures of any type or kind located above ground mobile building shall mean any covered portable structure consisting of a permanent chassis constructed on a skid form foundation andor placed on concrete piers and anchored by tiedowns and which is to be used for the enclosure of persons articles or chattels park shall mean the monroe airindustrial park as hereinafter described side building site line shall mean the boundary or property line dividing two 2 adjoining building sites side corner building site line shall mean the boundary or property line dividing a property located at the intersection of two 2 streets from the side or subordinate street rightofway  type of construction 1 no building shall be erected within the park which is of wooden or frame construction all structures shall be of attractive design and construction so as not to detract from the general appearance of the park as a whole walls fronting public streets should be finished with face brick finished metal or other attractive trim material 2 all buildings shall be of permanent construction no mobile buildings or other temporary structures shall be allowed except for temporary purposes for a specified period of time and only as approved by the advisory board 3 all utility lines shall be placed underground adequate lighting of appropriate intensities for building illumination signage parking lots and driveways shall be installed lighting shall be attractive in design to complement building site improvements light sources shall be hooded or controlled and arranged so as to deflect light away from adjacent properties and public streets bare incandescent bulbs shall not be permitted in view of adjacent property or public rightofway  building lines 1 no part of any building shall be constructed on any building site within the park closer than fifty 50 feet from the rightofway of any street designated for public use 2 no building shall be constructed on any building site within the park closer than fifteen 15 feet to the rear or side building site lines  loading docks 1 irrespective of the other requirements set forth in this article pertaining to building lines no truck dock or loading space shall be constructed upon any building site within the park so that trucks tractors trailers or any combination thereof will while either being maneuvered or being loaded or unloaded project beyond twenty 20 feet of any public street rightofway 2 no loading docks shall be constructed on the front of any building within the park unless approved by the advisory board the front of any building for the purposes of this provision is defined to mean any side of a building which faces a street designated for public use  parking 1 no parking shall be permitted upon any street designated for public use 2 each occupant of a building site within the park shall provide approved offstreet automobile parking facilities to be based generally but not specifically at the minimum rate of one parking space for each one and onehalf 112 employees to be employed on the premises by the occupant thereof  open storage areas and fences 1 no goods equipment supplies or other materials shall be stored in the open upon any building site in the park except on the rear twothirds  23  thereof and then only when such open storage area is fenced with a screening fence at least six 6 feet in height and of adequate height to screen storage from visibility 2 all fencing for screening security or other purposes shall be attractive in appearance and shall be an all metal industrial type fence or galvanized or nonferrous material or shall be of brick masonry or other material of nondeteriorating nature no wood fence shall be permitted  landscaping 1 all open areas upon each building site within the park shall be attractively landscaped with lawn trees and shrubs according to landscape plans first approved in writing by the advisory board 2 street trees shall be included in the landscape plan along any public street planted in a uniform line of regular and appropriate spacing and should be of a longlived variety native to north louisiana 3 massive areas of concrete or asphalt not used for vehicular access circulation or maneuvering including parking areas should have internal areas of landscaping spaced at appropriate intervals to provide visual relief and should include trees 4 all visible building mechanical and service equipment fences bordering public streets and any other objectionable view shall be screened with a landscape planting 5 provision should be made for the adequate watering of all landscaping 6 all areas shall be maintained in an attractive and wellkept condition  signage 1 no billboards or advertising signs other than those identifying the name products and business of the person or firm occupying a building site within the park shall be permitted 2 all signage shall be of professional design with appropriate content pleasing in appearance of sound construction and properly lighted 3 without board consent no sign shall exceed the height of ten 10 feet sign size should be appropriate in proportion to the building and should be no larger than eighty 80 square feet 4 signage shall not be erected in any public rightofway 5 all signage shall be maintained in a neat and orderly fashion and updated and painted regularly where appropriate  general cleanliness and upkeep 1 each building site shall be kept in a safe clean healthful and presentable condition at all times 2 all open trash collection areas shall be on the rear twothirds  23  of the building site fenced with a screening fence or combination of fence and landscape screening at least six 6 feet in height and of adequate height to screen area from visibility 3 no occupant of a building site within the park shall maintain or operate an incinerator for disposing of trash and debris  applicability of other laws 1 each occupant of a building site within the park shall at all times be subject to the laws of the united states the state of louisiana and the ordinances of the city of monroe as well as the rules and regulations of the federal aviation administration or its successor agency concerning the use occupancy and operations of the airport facility known as the monroe regional airport 2 each occupant of a building site within the park shall be subject to all of the ordinances of the city of monroe without limitation but particularly including the building code plumbing code electrical code sewer pretreatment code and life safety code of the city  waiver or modification of article any or all of the restrictions in this article may be waived or modified for any or all existing owneroccupants or for a new owneroccupant by a favorable vote of seventyfive 75 per cent in number of the owneroccupants occupying spaces within the park at the time said waiver or modification is to be granted to be evidenced by written instrument signed by the assenting owneroccupants and by the unanimous written consent of the advisory board  reservation of powers to city the council of the city of monroe hereby reserved unto itself the right power and authority to impose additional covenants restrictions and conditions upon the property located in the park provided that such additional covenants restrictions and conditions which may be hereafter imposed may not be so construed as to require any owneroccupant to change the location of or to abandon any structure located on the premises or to change the nature and manner of operating its business provided that this section shall not in any way operate as an abridgment or restriction of equipment shall not include standard automobile radios when used and heard only by the occupants of the vehicle in which the automobile radio is installed soundamplifying equipment as used in this
