expire          violations a administration of enforcement the provisions of these land use regulations shall be administered by the mayor or hisher designee as designated herein who shall have the power to make inspections of buildings or premises necessary to carry out their administrative duties in the enforcement of these regulations the mayor or hisher designee may call upon the police to furnish the necessary personnel to carry out enforcement if necessary b violations and enforcement proceedings in case any structure is erected or structurally altered or maintained or any structure or land is used or altered or is not maintained in violation of these regulations the planning and urban development director or hisher designee may institute any appropriate action or proceedings to prevent such unlawful construction or alteration or use or other violations to restrain to correct or to prevent any illegal act conduct any business or maintain any use in or about such premises furthermore any resident of the community who believes that a violation of any of the provisions of these regulations is occurring may file a written complaint with the mayor such complaint shall fully set forth the acts or omissions constituting the alleged violation and the site or sites at which such violation or violations are alleged to be occurring the planning and zoning director or hisher designee shall record properly such complaint promptly investigate the allegations underlying said complaint and take action on such complaint and take action on such complaints as provided by these regulations c responsibility for violations whenever the planning and zoning director or hisher designee on the basis of a written complaint has reason to believe that a violation of these regulations may exist he or she may require any person owning the structure or land or operating a use thereon to provide within thirty 30 days of notification or the next available city of monroe environmental court date information as may be necessary in his judgment to determine the existence or extent of any violation d penalty any person violating any provision of these regulations shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and deemed a public nuisance and upon conviction shall be punished for each separate offense by a fine of ten dollars $1000 to twentyfive dollars $2500 but not exceeding five hundred dollars $50000 or imprisonment for a term not exceeding sixty 60 days each day any violation of any provision of these regulations shall continue shall constitute a separate offense    appendix a  personnel system footnotes  1  editors note appendix a is derived from adopted  the internal arrangement and numbering of the ordinance have been retained as has the basic language any editorial emendations made for the purpose of clarity have been included in brackets where necessary the editor has added catchlines for the convenience of the user because of the nature of definitions catchlines have been deemed unnecessary future amendments to the ordinance will be included in their proper places  and a history note showing the derivation of the amendment will be appended to the section lack of such a history note indicates the section is derived from chapter 1  personnel merit system 11  established a sevenmember personnel merit system commission will be established in the following manner a the mayor will appoint three 3 members b the city council will appoint two 2 members c local union 238 afscme union will elect one 1 member d a permanent employee of the citys classified service will be elected by the citys classified service employees who are not members of a union 12  terms the terms of the commission will be six 6 years these terms will be staggered on a threeyear basis 13  election of chairman the members of the commission shall meet and organize by electing one of its members as chairman at the first meeting of each year thereafter 14  meetings the commission shall meet at least monthly and shall announce each meeting to the general public at least ten 10 days prior to the meeting all business meetings will be open to the public except as provided by the states open meeting law 15  rules regulations procedures the commission shall establish its own rules regulations and procedures and not be bound by any other rules of order evidence or procedure in its meetings hearings or investigations except such as may be established by applicable state or federal law 16  quorum a quorum shall be constituted when four 4 members are present for the transaction of business 17  rulings the concurrence of a majority of the authorized members will constitute a ruling upon any item before the commission 18  secretary the director of personnel will act as secretary to the commission but will have no voting power 19  minutes minutes of the proceedings shall be prepared and forwarded to the director of administration by the director of personnel on behalf of and subject to the approval of the commission 110  powers of the commission the commission shall have the following powers a to represent the public interest in the improvements of personnel administration in the city for all classified employees b to conduct investigations and hearings whenever it has reason to believe the provisions of the merit system or rules thereof are being violated by a person or persons of the city or its management  to hold public hearings to investigate charges of such violations having been filed within c to provide and establish change or alter rules or regulations for the operations of the personnel of the city within the scope of the charter and this ordinance d to hear appeals from employees and others who claim their rights under these rules have been violated and are to rule in such cases e to enforce its rules regulations and orders in the courts of the state 111  amendments amendments to these rules shall not be effective until after approved by the commission after a public hearing has been conducted and until the amendments have been adopted as an ordinance of the city of monroe chapter 2  director of personnel 21  duties of the director of personnel the director of personnel shall have the following duties a to serve as secretary to the commission and prepare and forward to the director of administration all minutes of the commissions meetings rulings and findings b to serve as executive and administrative head of the division of personnel under the department of administration c to establish and maintain a roster of all classified and unclassified employees of the city  set forth for each employee the class title the salary any change in class title or pay and all other necessary personnel data d to formulate and prescribe procedures and to publish them in the form of an employee manual and maintain the update thereof e to promote and increase efficiency responsiveness to the public and economy in the city classified service f to provide fair and equal opportunity for qualified persons to enter and progress in the city service in a manner based on merit and fitness as ascertained practical personnel management methods g to maintain recruitment advancement and tenure practices enhancing the attractiveness of the city career and encouraging each employee to give their best effort to the city and public h to develop and propose to the commission a uniform classification and pay plan and maintain it on a continuing basis by recommending amendments thereto i to provide high morale among city employees by fostering good working relationships and by providing uniform personnel policies opportunities for advancement and consideration of employee need and desires j to develop training educational and safety programs k to make and publish annual reports as requested by the commission mayor or city council l to make investigations into alleged violations of these rules m to establish mandatory uniform grievance procedures within the departments of the city n to perform any other acts and functions which he may consider necessary or desirable to carry out the purpose of administration 22  promotion of affirmative action the director shall perform all is duties in an effort to promote affirmative action 23  equal employment opportunity affirmative action shall be taken by the director to ensure equal employment opportunity in the citys classified service chapter 3  persons governed by these rules 31  classified and unclassified positions a all employees of the city shall be members of the classified service except the following 1 all elected city officials 2 the mayors secretary and any assistants to the mayor 3 persons employed on a temporary or contractual basis 4 the city attorney and any assistant city attorneys 5 heads of departments created by or under the home rule charter of the city of monroe 6 any employee appointed directly by the council 7 employees governed under the state of louisiana fire and police civil service b upon the changing of the charter state law or court decision the city may add additional positions to the unclassified service c the commission upon submission of adequate justification by the mayor or city council and after considering the recommendations of the director of personnel may recommend to the city council the addition of positions to the unclassified service or the revocation of any positions in the unclassified service which is not covered by the city charter state law or court decision d all temporary personnel services which are for a period under thirty 30 days unless approved by the commission chapter 4  equal opportunity policy 41  established affirmative action shall be taken to ensure equal employment opportunity in the city service discrimination against any person in recruitment examination appointment training promotion discipline or any other aspect of personnel administration because of political or religious opinions or affiliations membership or nonmembership in employee organization or because of race color creed national origin marital status or other nonmerit factors are prohibited discrimination on the basis of age sex or physical disability is prohibited except where specific age sex or physical requirement constitutes a bona fide occupational qualification necessary to proper and efficient administration chapter 5  classification plan 51  preparation by director the director after consultation with the departments concerned shall cause to be prepared a classification plan and from time to time amendments thereto for presentation to the commission for its approval following public hearings this plan shall consist of job specifications designated standard class titles designed to provide for all classes in the classified service 52  submittal to mayor and council all approved plans and amendments thereof shall be submitted after approval of the commission director of administration to the mayor and then to the city council 53  approval by commission an original classification plan or amendments thereto shall become effective only after the approval of the commission and after adoption as an ordinance of the city of monroe provided funds are available and appropriated by the governing authorities for implementation of the plan 54  allocation of positions the director as soon as practicable after adoption of a classification plan hereunder after consultation with the departments concerned shall allocate each position in the classified service to its appropriate class and thereafter shall allocate each new position in such service to its appropriate class and may reallocate position from class to class in making such allocations he shall provide uniform application of the classification plan to positions under different departments 55  appointment only to allocated positions no person may be appointed until the position is allocated by the director 56  approval of new classes if new classes are requested the classification system will be viewed as changed and the approval must be in accordance with rule 2 and 3 of this chapter 57  right of appeal to director regarding allocation or reallocation an employee affected by allocation or reallocation of a position to a class shall have thirty 30 days to have his case reviewed by the director or by a representative of the director the directors decision shall be final in these matters unless there is an allegation that his ruling has been discriminatory in which case the employee may appeal the decision to the commission in accord with chapter 12 58  titles of classes the title of each class will be the official title of every position allocated to the class the department may use any working title of a position he deems necessary with the approval of the director 59  employment only under class title no employee in the classified service shall be appointed employed or paid under any title other than of the class to which the position is allocated or reallocated 510  force and effect of classes a the specification of classes will have the following parts 1 definitions will be descriptive and not restrictive 2 list or example of duties and responsibilities a general duties b specific tasks c responsibilities d qualifications requirements e relations to other similar classes f statement of necessary special qualifications 511  reallocations and title change a when an employees position or class title is changed or reallocated he is entitled to serve therein without change in status if he meets the requirements set forth for the class chapter 6  uniform merit pay plan 61  preparation the director after consultation with departments and director of administration and affording such investigations and research as deemed desirable shall cause to be prepared a uniform merit pay plan the submission and approval of such plan will be in accordance with rules 51 52 and 53 62  amendments any amendments thereof shall be submitted and approved in accordance with rules 51 52 and 53 and rule 61 63  rates of paytypes the rates of pay in the uniform pay plan shall consist of the following a a minimum rate b a maximum rate c such intermediate rates as may be adopted by the commission and approved by the mayor and city council 64  samedetermination rates of pay upon employment shall be fixed at the entrance rate of the class to which the position is allocated except that a when economic or employment condition makes recruitment of eligibles at the minimum rate for the class difficult the director may request special entrance rates for that class with the approval of the director of administration and commission b if a special entrance rate is approved all employees in the class must be raised to the new entrance rate of the class c no employee can because of the rule exceed the maximum step of the pay plan for the class which his position is allocated 65  persons reentering servicegenerally a person reentering city service within a period of three 3 years except for military service may be placed in the corresponding step in which he left as long as it does not exceed the maximum amount of pay which he was earning when he left 66  sameupon returning from military service a person returning from military service shall be restored to duty in compliance with the universal military training and service act 67  transfer reassignment pay upon transfer or reassignment will be the same as the position they are transferring from 68  promotion pay upon promotion will be established at the next higher step in the range of the new class 69  demotion pay upon demotion may be set at any lower step within the lower class but cannot exceed or be equal to the amount being paid before demotion 610  merit increase each employee is eligible for but not automatically entitled to a merit increase after the first six 6 months of employment and each year thereafter until the maximum step is achieved these increases are merit increases and in no way should be viewed as longevity or costofliving increase 611  maximum rate all increases herein authorized are subject to the requirement that no employees pay shall exceed the maximum rate of pay established for the class of position the employee occupies 612  compensation of parttime employees compensation of parttime employees will be set as a fulltime employee except that all benefits including pay will be prorated to his percentage of time 613  change of pay plan when the pay plan is changed the rate of pay will be established in accordance to the next higher step of the plan 614  individual increases a department head may after presenting justifiable reasons in writing to the commission and with its approval increase an employees pay at any time to any step in the range for the class but not beyond the maximum for the class the department head must have approval of the director of administration and mayor before submitting this request to the commission 615  certification and payment no payment for personal service shall be made by the director of administration without the certification of personnel action forms from the director of personnel 616  rates for reallocation rates of pay for reallocation will be the same as promotion demotion reassignment whichever is applicable 617  rules for overtime pay the director shall set the rules of payment for overtime holidays and other fringe benefits with the concurrence of the director of administration and present them for approval of the commission the mayor and council 618  uniformity all compensation will be treated uniformly throughout the city departments 619  costofliving raises costofliving raises will not become part of the pay plan and will be administered by the mayor and city council chapter 7  certification and appointment 71  filling of vacancies vacancies in the classified service may be filled by original appointment promotion reassignment demotion transfer reinstatement following an appeal restoration to duty following military service or by noncompetitive reemployment 72  new positions when the need for a new position exists the department will request director of administration who will certify the availability of funds to the director for a list of eligibles to make such an appointment 73  anticipation of vacancies the department should anticipate as far in advance as practicable the vacancy to permit the director to prepare a list of eligibles for filling of the vacancy 74  certification of eligibles the director shall certify to the department the names of the eligibles from the appropriate list for the class in which the vacant position exists 75  selective certification selective certification may be requested and approved by the director when a the department requests and adequately justifies that to perform certain duties of a class a person must possess particular qualifications b in specific instances and pursuant to and in conformity with an order of the court commission or agency of competent jurisdiction the director may make selective certification 76  certification only of available applicants the director shall make the determination of availability for appointment and certify only the available applicants to the department 77  recommendation the department director will recommend the person whom he wishes for appointment to the position the director will appoint and certify the appointment to the director of administration 78  emergency appointments a all appoints appointments of less than thirty 30 days will be filled as a temporary appointment b the director may approve an emergency appointment to exceed one hundred eighty 180 days  however no employee may serve over one hundred eighty 180 days without being appointed in conformity of these rules 79  temporary positions time span no position appointed over thirty 30 days will be classed as a temporary position and must have the approval of the commission temporary positions are for thirty 30 days or less 710  cancellation of employment the director may cancel the employment of any applicant or of any employee serving with other than permanent status following certification or employment if a his employment in the classified service would be prohibited by law b his conduct has been infamous or disgraceful c he lacks the qualifications for the class or position d he is physically unfit for the position e he is addicted to habitual use of drugs or intoxicating liquors f he has been adjudged guilty in court of a crime involving moral turpitude g he has been dismissed from public service for cause h he has made false statement concerning his qualifications or prior employment status or other material information which caused his certification to examination or employment 711  types of appointment in the classified service there will be seven 7 types of appointments certified by the director a emergency appointments an appointment for thirtyone 31 days to one hundred eighty 180 days with the approval of the commission no fringe benefits will be given for these types of position b temporary position an appointment for less than thirty 30 days this position will be part of the classified service however if an appointment of any individual is for over thirty 30 days it will become an emergency appointment and must come under the classified service c probationary appointment when a position is filled by original appointment the employee serves a sixmonth period of probation d provisional appointment when a person is appointed from a list of eligibles of less than five 5 applicants the director may rule this as a provisional appointment and in the event a list of eligibles are recorded within ninety 90 days he may rule that the position must be competitive if the director has not made such ruling within ninety 90 days the position will become classified as probationary and the employee will be treated as a probationary employee and be given credit of time served in this status e permanent appointment when an employee has served his six 6 months probationary appointment he becomes a permanent classified employee f job appointment this is an appointment with a period of appointment with beginning and ending date this employee is entitled to fringe benefits and the appointment cannot extend over eighteen 18 months an appointment must be made from a list of eligibles g noncompetitive reemployment when an employee is reappointed within three 3 years after he has left city service the employee is reemployed at no greater rate than he earned before he left the classified service the type appointment is also a probational appointment 712  rights of departmentdirectors approval required the department may with the approval of the director a reassign an employee to another position for which the employee is qualified as long as the position has the same entrance level b demote an employee to another position for cause provided the employee is qualified c detail to another position for a period not to exceed one hundred eighty 180 days with pay an employee who is qualified for the position to be detailed to 713  samereport to director the department may by reporting to the director a change the duty station b change the working hours c transfer to the same class or to a comparable class with the same entrance rate that the employee is qualified chapter 8  probationary period 81  appointments affected probationary periods will be served for the following appointments a probationary appointments b noncompetitive reemployments c provisional appointments which after ninety 90 days have been changed to probationary appointments the probationary period shall be an essential part of the employment process and shall be utilized for the most effective adjustment of a new employee and for the elimination of any probationary employee whose performance does not meet the requirements standard of work 82  exceptions a permanent employee who has been promoted transferred reassigned or demoted to another position shall not be required to serve another probationary period 83  removal of probationary employees a probationary employee may be removed by the department with written reason being provided to the director and the employee 84  probationary period for parttime employees a probationary period for a parttime employee will be six 6 months 85  when permanent appointment begins a permanent appointment will begin at the end of a probationary appointment 86  extension the director may extend the probationary period up to twelve 12 months upon written request from the department giving reason for the request extension no probationary period will be granted over twelve 12 months chapter 9  performance appraisal 91  authorized performance appraisals will be made on all employees who have been in a position for ninety 90 days during the period of january 1  each employee will receive his or her evaluation by february 1 of each year 92  procedure the performance appraisals will be made as follows a the supervisor will evaluate each employee under their supervision on the appropriate form provided by the director b the supervisor the department head or his designee and the employee will review the annual appraisal and sign and the employee will be given a copy thereof c the department head will forward all appraisals to the director by february 1 of each year 93  final rating the final rating on all performance appraisals will be one of the five 5 following categories as provided for on the performance appraisal form provided by the director a excellent b good c satisfactory d fair e unsatisfactory 94  appeal appeal of an unsatisfactory evaluation will be as follows a an employee will appeal his evaluation to his department head within thirty 30 days from the date on which he signed and received a copy of said evaluation this appeal will be in writing and give reason thereof why they feel the evaluation should be changed b the department head will review the evaluation and give his determination within ten 10 days of the receipt of the appeal to the employee c upon the receipt of the answer the employee has the right to appeal the decision of the department head to the mayor within ten 10 days of the receipt of the department heads decision d the mayor or his designee will review the appeal and have a hearing concerning the appeal and issue a written answer to the employee within fifteen 15 days of the hearing e within thirty 30 days of the notification an employee may appeal to the commission after the above appeals have been exhausted 95  effect of unsatisfactory evaluation the effect of an unsatisfactory evaluation is a the employee becomes ineligible for 1 any promotion  or 2 any salary increase b the employee may be subject to further disciplinary actions including discharge 96  rerating after unsatisfactory evaluation in the case of an employee receiving an unsatisfactory evaluation they must be rerated by september 1 of that year this also must be reported to the director 97  effect of lack of appraisal if a permanent employee does not have any official performance appraisal record in the directors office they shall be considered as having a satisfactory rating chapter 10  hours of work and forms of leave 101  workweek established each employee shall have a workweek established as forty 40 hours per week 102  longer workweek the city may specify a workweek exceeding forty 40 hours for employees in specific classes of position with the approval of the commission for employees in specific departments 103  recording of hours the director shall record the number of hours and days which will constitute the regular workweek 104  time employees time employees shall have the work established for parttime work and rules 1 2 and 3 shall be used 105  intermittent employees when the services are not needed on a regular basis the commission shall authorize intermittent workers the director may appoint an employee to serve on an intermittent basis on an hourly daily weekly or monthly basis 106  overtime an employee in classified service may be required by the city to work overtime any time the department requires the employee to work overtime they must perform the hours of work 107  types of leave all fulltime employees shall earn sick and vacation annual leave by the following schedule a vacation annual leave a fulltime employee is guaranteed a paid vacation annual leave drawable in advance as per the following schedule 1 6 months1 year 5 days working 2 1 year5 years 10 days working 3 6 years10 years 15 days working 4 11 years20 years  20 days working 5 21 years and over 25 days working no vacation annual leave may be taken by an employee until heshe has been in the service of the city continuously for a period of six 6 months the employee can accrue up to one hundred twenty 120 days vacation and will be paid for all accruals at retirement separation or death holidays occurring during an employees scheduled vacation shall not be charged to hisher vacation time in any case b sick leave any employee contracting or incurring any nonserviceconnected sickness or disability which renders such employee unable to perform the duties of his employment shall receive sick leave with pay employees shall be eligible for sick leave after ninety 90 days service with the employer employees shall be allowed one 1 day sick leave for each month of service sick leave shall be earned by an employee for any month in which the employee is compensated for five 5 or more hours of work employees shall start to earn sick leave from their date of hire and they shall accumulate sick leave as long as they are in the service of the employer sick leave may be accumulated up to a maximum of one hundred twenty 120 days when an employee finds it necessary to be absent for any of the reasons specified herein heshe shall cause the facts to be reported to hisher department head thirty 30 minutes prior to the regular time for reporting to work an employee must keep his department head informed of hisher condition if the absence is of more than three 3 days duration an employee may be required to submit a medical certificate for any absence after the third day in any one usage after an employee has banked twelve 12 unused sick days heshe has the option to either continue accruing such time or receiving in cash in december on a 1 to 2 ratio all time which heshe elects to cash in for accumulated sick leave all over twelve 12 days heshe must keep banked at all times 108  activities not earning sick or annual leave no employee shall earn annual or sick leave for a overtime hours b for any hours of leave without pay c while he is on leave with or without pay until such time as he returns to active work except where inability to return to work is caused by illness or disability d for any hours of oncall status e for hours of travel outside of his normal work hours f for any hours of a holiday or other nonwork day 109  request for annual leave when an employee requests annual leave it must be applied for in advance by the employee and may only be used with the approval of the department head or his designated representative 1010  effect of nonwork days on annual leave no annual leave shall be charged for a nonwork day 1011  reduction of annual leave no employee shall be required to reduce his annual leave below thirty 30 days however the employee may be required to reduce his annual leave to this amount by the department 1012  payment of annual and sick leave upon separation annual and sick leave shall be paid upon separation as follows a employees shall be compensated in cash for any accumulated unused leave when they are permanently separated from employment as a result of voluntary resignation discharge retirement or death in the event of death payment is to be made to the estate of the employee b the amount of payment of all unused leave is to be calculated at the employees rate of pay in effect on the pay day immediately preceding the employees separation 1013  payment beyond last day of work disallowed no payment for annual leave may be used to continue the employee as a classified employee beyond the last day of work 1014  grounds for sick leave sick leave may be utilized by an employee for absence of duty for the following a illness or injury b medical dental or optical consultation or treatment 1015  minimum charges of leave all charges of sick or annual leave will be for a minimum of onehalf hour 1016  physicians certification authorized the department may require the employee to file a certification from a registered physician or some other acceptable proof that the employee is unable to perform because of illness 1017  advance leave prohibited advance of sick or annual leave to an employee is prohibited 1018  special leave employees shall be given special leave for the following a performing jury duty b summoned to appear in court as long as they are not the plaintiff or defendant in an action separate from their city employment c the city determines that he is prevented from doing his duties because of an act of god d the city determines that because of local celebrations it is impracticable to work e the employee is ordered to active training for the army reserve or national guard f for special needs of certain relatives g education leave if it is within the scope of employment and is limited to thirty 30 days per year the city may give additional education leave to employees with the approval of the commission 1019  leave without pay no leave without pay shall be approved for any employee over one 1 year without the approval of the commission all leave without pay over thirty 30 days will be sent to the director in writing 1020  termination authorized after sick leave exhausted when an employee has exhausted all sick leave they may be terminated without prejudice if the department certifies that the position must be filled no position will be doubly encumbered as a permanent position in the classified service however he shall retain his reemployment status upon release from a doctor to the director that he is available for reemployment 1021  curtailment authorized the city may curtail any leave of absence it has granted provided that the city gives the employee fifteen 15 days to return to work if the employee does not return to work on the requested day he can be removed from the classified service 1022  holidays all classified employees will have the following holiday schedule and will be paid in accordance with the amount of the working hours or workweek they are to perform a new years day b good friday c memorial day d independence day e
