basis provided that all time is used or paid for on a one and onehalf 112 times basis within six 6 months of the time it is accumulated chapter 11  disciplinary actions separation and layoff 111  authorized the city may take action to suspend remove demote reduce in pay reassign or reprimand any classified employee for cause 112  suspensions a any employee suspended without pay shall be notified on or before the effective date of the suspension b any employee suspended shall be furnished detailed reason of the suspension in writing within ten 10 days of the effective date of the suspension c any employee who has been suspended without pay may be paid for time lost if after investigation the commission decides that disciplinary action was not warranted the director shall authorize the reimbursement with the approval of the director of administration 113  adverse actions for causereasons  appeal in all adverse actions for cause the department must furnish the employee in writing the following a detailed reason must be furnished for the action on or before the action is taken b in the written notice the statement you may appeal this action to the personnel merit commission within thirty 30 days shall be placed on all adverse actions c all adverse actions must be sent to director within five 5 days of the action 114  samedelivery all actions for cause shall be delivered to the employee by a personal service to the employee on the job or at their residence  or b sent to the employees lastknown address on file in the personnel office mailed certified mail return receipt requested 115  layoff when the city determines that a reduction in the work force is necessary the following procedures will be followed a the director of administration will notify the director of the intent of layoff and the number of personnel and department by class to be laid off b the director will prepare a layoff list by department by laying off employees in seniority order by classification in the following order 1 temporary employees 2 job appointment employees 3 probationary employees 4 permanent employees c this layoff will be made in seniority order by class and will be citywide and not limited to one 1 department d no permanent employee will be laid off while the city has other types of appointments which could be laid off within the city e if a permanent employee is laid off his name will be placed in the first available position in the class in which he qualifies f when a layoff is in progress an employee must be offered any available position for which he qualifies on a seniority basis  however once offered a position and the position is declined the employee no matter what the status will be laid off and placed on the preferred hire list 116  resignationletter required when an employee voluntarily resigns he or she must give the personnel office a written letter of resignation 117  samewithdrawal requirements any employee who resigns may not receive or withdraw such resignation without mutual agreement between the employee and the department chapter 12  appeals and hearings 121  authorized any action taken by the city or department thereof may be appealed to the commission grievance procedure by the following a any person who feels that they have been discriminated against because of any adverse action from employment b any employee serving in permanent status who has had adverse action taken against them c any person in the classified service that alleges that they have been deprived of any right discriminated against or adversely affected by the violation of any rule or provision of these rules 122  definition a grievance is hereby defined to mean a dispute concerning the meaning interpretation or application of any of the provisions of the personnel merit system which may not be covered by a current labor agreement and shall be settled in accord with the following grievance procedure hereinafter set forth  provided however that the discussion and settlement of the grievance shall in no way disrupt the citys work schedules 123  procedure the grievance procedure is as follows step no 1 a grievance shall be presented orally to the aggrieved employees immediate supervisor within five 5 working days from the act or omission giving rise to the grievance an earnest attempt will be made to arrive at a settlement thereof failing satisfactory adjustment within three 3 working days the grievance may be submitted to the employees department head by the aggrieved employee andor a representative of his choice within five 5 working days step no 2 the grievance when referred to the department head shall be in writing and shall state the specific reasons for the grievance and specify the pertinent details of the act or omission giving rise to said grievance the department head or his designee shall conduct a hearing on the grievance within five 5 working days if the department head or his designee fails to adjust the grievance in a satisfactory manner within five 5 working days after the hearing the employee andor his representative may appeal the grievance to the mayor within five 5 days step no 3 the mayor or his designee shall conduct a hearing on the grievance within ten 10 working days if the mayor or his designee fails to adjust the grievance satisfactorily within five 5 working days the employee andor his representative may appeal the grievance to the personnel merit system commission step no 4 appeal to personnel merit system commission 124  filing of appeals all appeals to the commission must a be filed within thirty 30 days following the action taken by the mayor and be filed in the directors office b be in writing c be signed by the employee or appellant or by an attorney on his or her behalf d have the name and mailing address of the appellant or employee e contain a clear and concise statement of the actions and the basis for which the appeal is being made f if discrimination is alleged as a basis for appeal show the specific facts supporting the discrimination and must be in detail g give the date the action occurred and the date the employee or appellant learned of the action h indicate the relief sought 125  time of appeals all appeals shall run for thirty 30 calendar days and will not be delayed for holidays or weekends or other types of leave given to an employee except when the thirtieth day falls on a city nonwork day the period will be extended to the next city work day 126  docketing of appeals the director will note the date of filing in his office and forward copies to the mayor director of administration and department head concerned he will cause all appeals to be docketed for hearing by the commission within thirty 30 days from the date of filing with at least ten 10 days advance notice of the hearing 127  dismissal of appeals the city may request any appeal not meeting the specification of this chapter or the rules to be summarily dismissed 128  hearings by commission all docketed appeals will be heard by the commission at a place assigned and both parties shall be present either voluntarily or 9  hearings to be public all hearings shall be public and all parties have the right of counsel or representation of their choice all hearings will be held in accord with chapter 1 paragraph 15 1210  oath all testimony will be under oath 1211  decisionsstatus the decision rendered by the commission will be the official position of the commission 1212  sameappealauthorized the parties have the legal right to appeal this decision to the next court of jurisdiction within thirty 30 days of the decision of the commission 1213  samesamepayment of cost all cost of such appeals will be borne by the individuals 1214  issuance of written decision a written decision will be issued by the commission containing its findings of facts and conclusions the decision shall be final on the day that it is filed with the director if the commission orders a reinstatement the city will reinstate on the day which is ordered 1215  settlement the city and employee may reach an amicable settlement after an appeal is docketed the city must report such settlement to the director chapter 13  records and reports 131  payroll and attendance recordsmaintenance it shall be the duty of the director with the approval of the director of administration and mayor to design a system to facilitate the maintenance of adequate personnel records and to eliminate duplication of accounting and reporting to the fullest extent practicable 132  samecertification all payroll and attendance records will be certified by the employee and the department head 133  personnel action all personnel action will be reported on the prescribed personnel action forms and these forms signed by the director shall constitute authorization under the classified system 134  leave records leave records will be maintained by the director 135  audit of payroll and leave records authorized the director may from time to time audit any and all payroll and leave records of the city in the classified service chapter 14  definitions the following words and phrases when uses in these rules shall have the following meanings 141 abandonment of position means the desertion by a classified employee of his position 142 allocation means the determination of the class to which a position in the classified service shall be deemed to pertain 143 annual leave is leave with pay granted an employee for the purpose of rehabilitation restoration and maintenance of work efficiency or transaction of personal affairs 144 appointment means an offer to a qualified person of employment in a classified position and the acceptance of such offer 145 bona fide student means a person enrolled in an accredited high school college or university in the state or person enrolled in a stateoperated vocationaltechnical school in a sufficient number of courses and classes in such institution to be classified as a fulltime regular student under the criteria used by the institution in which he is enrolled  enrolled in an institution of higher education as defined in section 461b of the higher education act a bona fide student shall not lose his status for vacation during an academic year or summer recess 146 class means one 1 or more positions in the classified service so nearly alike in essential characteristics as to warrant like treatment for all personnel purposes 147 classified position means any office or position in the classified service 148 classified service is defined as that body of employees performing personal services to and for the city of monroe except those rendering such services who are specifically exempt from the classified service by the city charter and these rules 149 commission means the city of monroe personnel merit systems commission 1410 continuing position means an office or position of employment in the classified service which reasonably can be expected to continue for more than twelve 12 months 1411 continuous city service means uninterrupted status of a classified employee of the city exclusive of interruption caused by authorized leave of absence layoff of not more than one 1 year military service consisting of active duty in the armed forces of the united states for not more than six 6 years of voluntary service or an indefinite period of involuntary service 1412 demotion means a change of a permanent or probationary employee from a position of one class to a position of another class for which a lower minimum rate of pay is prescribed 1413 preferred reemployment list means a list containing the names of former classified employees who have noncompetitive reemployment rights in a particular class or classes in a certain department 1414 designated holiday means a holiday or part of a holiday an employee observes in lieu of a regular holiday observed by the city because the regular holiday or a portion thereof fell on the employees regular day off 1415 director means the director of the department of personnel 1416 detail to special duty means the temporary assignment of an employee to perform the duties and responsibilities of a position other than the one to which he is regularly assigned without prejudice to his rights in and to his regular position 1417 discrimination means consideration of religious or political beliefs sex race or any other nonmerit factors 1418 eligible means any person who is currently on an eligible list for employment with the city 1419 emergency appointment means a temporary appointment made necessary by an emergency work situation which will not exceed ninety 90 days 1420 job appointment means a temporary appointment of an employee for work of a temporary nature or to substitute for another employee not to exceed six 6 months 1421 layoff means the removal of an employee from a position because of lack of work lack of funds or for other causes other than disciplinary actions 1422 leave of absence without pay is leave or time off from work granted by the city for which period the employee receives no pay 1423 original appointment means initial appointment of a person to a classified position by provisional probationary or job appointment 1424 pay means salary wages fees allowances and all other forms of valuable consideration or the amount of any one 1 or more of them earned by or paid to any employee for service rendered in any position but does not include any allowance for expense authorized and incurred as incidence to employment 1425 pay plan means all the rates of compensation prescribed by the commission and approved by the mayor and city council for classes of positions in the classified service 1426 political activity means an effort to support or oppose the election of a candidate for political office in an election in the city 1427 position means any employment in the classified service 1428 probationary appointment means appointment to test the employees ability to perform the job duties assigned 1429 promotion means a change of a permanent employee in the classified service from a position of one class to a position of another class for which a higher minimum rate of pay is provided in the pay plan 1430 promotional list means a list established in conformity with these rules of permanent employees who have demonstrated their fitness for a higher class position by successfully meeting the requirement of the commission for such higher class position and are eligible for promotion 1431 public hearing means a hearing held after public notice of at least ten 10 days at which any person may have a reasonable opportunity to be heard in accordance with such rules and regulations as may be adopted by the commission 1432 reallocation means a change in the allocation of a position from one class to another class where in the duties of the position have undergone a change 1433 reassignment means the change of a probationary or permanent employee from a position in one class to another position in a different class both classes of which have the same minimum rate of pay 1434 reemployment means the noncompetitive appointment of a person based on permanent status attained in former employment in the classified service for a period of three 3 years 1435 regular or permanent appointment means the status attained by a classified employee upon the successful completion of his probationary period 1436 reinstatement means the restoration of a former classified employee to duty and pay status pursuant to an order issued by the commission or an appellate court 1437 removal or dismissal means the termination of employment of an employee for cause 1438 resignation means the voluntary termination by an employee of his employment in the classified service 1439 seniority means an employees length of continuous service with the city since his last date of hire 1440 service rating means the individual rating of an employee made in accordance with the uniform service rating system established by these rules 1441 sick leave is leave with pay granted an employee who is suffering with a sickness or disability which prevents him from performing his usual duties and responsibilities or who requires dental or optical consultation or treatment 1442 suspension means the enforced leave of absence without pay of an employee for disciplinary purposes or during an investigation of alleged misconduct by the employee 1443 title change means a change in the title of the class to which a position is allocated without change in the positions duty and responsibility content 1444 transfer means the change of an employee from a position in one department to a position in another department without change in probational or permanent status and without a break in service of one 1 or more working days 1445 uniform pay plan means a pay plan which is uniform in all respects within all departments of the city for position in the classified service chapter 15  collective bargaining unit recognition 151  preamble in order to provide for the orderly certification and decertification of labor organizations seeking to enter into collective bargaining agreements with the city of monroe and as required by of the charter of the city of monroe the following rules and procedures shall apply whenever there is no federal or state law providing such procedures which would be applicable to city employees  152  bargaining units any group of employees of the city of monroe may seek to establish units for the purpose of bargaining collectively with the city of monroe in respect to rates of pay wages hours of employment employee grievances discipline and other conditions of employment all employees within a unit shall have common economic and working condition interests each unit shall consist of not less than fifteen 15 employees of the city of monroe no unit shall be recognized without the written approval of a majority of the employees contained within the proposed bargaining unit only full time employees employed by the city of monroe for more than ninety 90 days at the time of petitioning or voting shall be considered eligible to vote or petition  153  procedure to be recognized as a bargaining unit should any group of employees or any labor organization acting on their behalf desire to be recognized as a bargaining unit they shall submit a petition for recognition on a form to be promulgated by the department of administration division of human resources of the city bargaining units once recognized may not be divided without the decertification of the union for the entire bargaining unit the department of administration division of human resources will review the petition and approve or disapprove the definition of the bargaining unit written reasons shall be given for disapproval should the petition not be approved the employees may appeal within thirty 30 days to the city council and its decision on whether to approve or disapprove the proposed bargaining unit shall be final within thirty 30 days of approval of the bargaining unit definition or contemporaneously with the request for recognition of a bargaining unit the proposed representative of the unit or any employee within the bargaining unit shall submit a written request for an election signed by thirty 30 per cent of the employees of the proposed unit on a form promulgated by the department of administration division of human resources should the employees fail to submit the written request for election contemporaneously with the petition for formation of a bargaining unit or within thirty 30 days the proposed bargaining unit shall not be recognized and no requests for recognition of a bargaining unit covering the employees shall be entertained for a period of twelve 12 months from the last day the written request for election could have been submitted any person signing in favor of an election may withdraw his request at any time prior to fifteen 15 days before any election to recognize a bargaining unit and its representative by personally notifying in writing the director of human resources who shall note the time and date of delivery to him on the written withdrawal should a person withdraw his request his signature shall not be counted towards the number needed to hold the recognition election  154  elections after approval of the bargaining unit and submission of written consent of thirty 30 per cent of the employees of the unit an election by secret ballot shall be conducted by the department of administration division of human resources or its designee for the purpose of approving the creation of the bargaining unit and the recognition of a bargaining unit representative all permanent employees employed by the city for a period of more than ninety 90 days prior to the election and assigned to work on the date of the election within the proposed unit shall have the right to vote all ballots shall be opened in public at such place as designated by the department of administration division of human resources which place shall be reasonably calculated to accommodate all interested parties and such representatives of the news media as may wish to attend all ballots shall be counted by the department of administration division of human resources with the director of human resources determining the validity vel non of each ballot should any person desire to appeal the decision of the director of human resources as to the validity of a ballot such appeal shall be taken to the city council of the city of monroe within ten 10 days of the decision to either accept or reject the disputed ballot and the decision of the city council shall be final a majority vote of all employees within the bargaining unit shall be necessary for the creation of a bargaining unit andor recognition of the bargaining unit representative  155  confirmation of results the results of any election shall be confirmed in writing by the director of human resources to the city council upon confirmation of the results of the election such confirmation shall be presented to the city council of the city of monroe which body will recognize the bargaining representative if approved by a majority of the employees eligible to vote within the bargaining unit  156  decertification of representative should any employee or group of employees or any labor organization acting in their behalf desire to decertify a representative for a bargaining unit they shall submit a petition for decertification on a form to be promulgated by the department of administration division of human resources of the city together with the written request of thirty 30 per cent of the employees of the bargaining unit eligible to vote in an election for decertification the department of administration division of human resources will review the petition and signatures and approve or disapprove the decertification petition of the bargaining unit written reasons shall be given for disapproval should the petition be disapproved the employees may appeal within ten 10 days to the city council and its decision on whether to approve or disapprove the decertification petition shall be final within thirty 30 days of approval of the decertification petition a secret ballot election shall be conducted by the department of administration division of human resources or its designee for the purpose of approving or disapproving the decertification of a collective bargaining unit representative all permanent employees employed by the city for a period of more than ninety 90 days prior to the election and assigned to work within the bargaining unit shall have the right to vote all ballots shall be opened in public at such place as designated by the department of administration division of human resources as reasonably calculated to accommodate all interested parties and such representatives of the news media as may be interested all ballots shall be counted by the department of administration division of human resources with the director of human resources determining the validity vel non of each ballot should any person within the bargaining unit desire to appeal the decision of the director of human resources such appeal shall be taken to the city council of the city of monroe within ten 10 days of the decision to either accept or reject the disputed ballot and the decision of the city council shall be final a majority vote of all employees within the bargaining unit shall be necessary for the decertification of a bargaining unit representative  157  disputed ballots for certification and decertification elections all disputed ballots shall be placed in sealed envelopes one for ballots allowed one for ballots rejected and delivered to the clerk of the city council such ballots shall remain in the sealed envelopes until such time as the city council may take up the appeal of the ballots if any appeal is taken at any appeal of disputed ballots the director of human resources shall state the nature of the dispute concerning the ballots and the council shall act upon all ballots in accordance with its procedures  158  presentation of decertification results to council and effect of decertification on existing contracts upon the vote of a majority of the employees within a bargaining unit to decertify a representative the result of such election shall be transmitted to the city council fifteen 15 days after the election or fifteen 15 days after the council acts upon any disputed ballots whichever comes last should a representative be decertified any contract between that representative and the city of monroe shall be deemed null and void as of the date of the election for decertification no action of the council shall be necessary to formalize decertification or the lapse of any contract should the election result in less than a majority of eligible voters voting to decertify or a tie no further action shall be necessary and the vote for decertification shall be deemed to have failed  159  limitation on elections should a representative be certified or a bargaining unit not be recognized or a representative for a bargaining unit be decertified no election concerning that bargaining unit or any unit substantially the same as that bargaining unit for certification or decertification shall be held until twelve 12 months have elapsed after certification failure of recognition of a bargaining unit or decertification  appendix b  policy and procedure relative to drugs and alcohol footnotes  1  editors note appendix b is derived from adopted  the internal arrangement and numbering of the ordinance have been retained as has the basic language any editorial emendations made for the purpose of clarity have been included in brackets future amendments to the ordinance will be included in their proper places  and a history note showing the derivation of the amendment will be appended to the section lack of such a history note indicates the section is derived from article 1  policy purpose the city of monroe louisiana hereinafter referred to as city desires to maintain a safe healthful and productive environment for all of its employees and the public which they serve the city recognizes that the use of alcoholic beverages and the use of unauthorized drugs by city employees in the work environment is a threat to the public welfare and to the safety of the individual employee coworkers and the public in general in order to protect the health welfare and safety of the public the individual employee and coemployees and to heighten the efficiency and effectiveness of service to the public the city will act to eliminate any substance abuse which increases the potential for accidents absenteeism substandard performance poor employee morale and damage to the reputation of our community it is the goal of this policy and procedure to eliminate substance abuse in the city work environment policy the policy of the city of monroe is to promote and encourage a work environment for its employees which is free from substance abuse to achieve that end the following rules are implemented a the use possession concealment transportation manufacture distribution dispensation promotion sale or purchase of any unauthorized controlled substance or any unauthorized alcohol by any city employee on city premises or while on city business is strictly prohibited and shall subject the employee to adverse disciplinary action b no city employee shall be under the influence of or if subject to testing test positive for any unauthorized controlled substance or alcohol during the course of his or her employment c the use of drugs or medication prescribed by a licensed physician for an individual employee shall be permitted in the work environment subject to the following conditions 1 the drug or medication must be in its original container must be in the employees name and have the doctors name and prescription number on the label  2 the drug or medication may not be taken more often than is prescribed on the label  3 the prescription cannot be older than one 1 year  4 the employee whose name is on the prescription cannot allow the consumption of the drugs or a medication by any other person in the work place  5 if the employee taking the prescribed drug or medication is aware of any adverse side effects or if the container has such a warning the employee must inform his or her supervisor prior to using such substances on the job d in order to promote and enforce this policy a comprehensive program of substance abuse testing of city employees and applicants for city employment shall be instituted in accordance with the rules and conditions set forth herein e all employees shall be informed of this policy and the procedures set forth herein application this policy shall apply to all regular parttime casual or contract employees of the city this policy shall also apply to all applicants for employment with the city compliance with the provisions of this policy and its procedures shall be a condition of employment terms for purposes of this policy and its procedures the terms city premises shall mean and include all property offices facilities land platforms buildings structures fixtures installations boats automobiles trucks other vehicles and equipment whether owned leased used or controlled by the city the term work environment shall mean and include all areas locations vehicles or equipment entered encountered or utilized while in the course and scope of the employees city duty the term accident refers to any occurrence which causes injury or fatality produce physical damage to property or material or interrupts andor terminates scheduled work assignments the terms test and screen may be used interchangeably to describe the procedure utilized to determine the presence of prohibited substances article 2  substance abuse testing applicants for employment all individuals applying for any employment position with the city shall be informed that a preemployment substance abuse test shall be required as part of the application process employee testingcategory i a category i positions where the health welfare andor safety of the public coemployees and the individual employee is at risk shall be deemed safety sensitive positions including but not limited to the following firefighters  police officers  jailers  nurses  traffic signal maintenance  drawbridge operators  positions that require or allow the carrying of a firearm  operation of motorized vehicles including automobiles trucks tractors or other heavy equipment  positions that require the handling or use of highly volatile or explosive materials  positions that require or allow the operation of dangerous equipment  positions that entail working in dangerous conditions  positions that require the handling or use of chemical substances b all applicants for category i positions shall be required to satisfactorily pass a substance abuse screening prior to employment or promotion into any category i position c all employees who occupy category i positions shall participate in routine substance abuse screening in accordance with the following 1 all employees in category i positions shall be tested at least once every three 3 years  and 2 all employees in category i positions shall be subject to random routine substance abuse testing according to the procedures prepared by the department of administration with at least thirtythree and onethird 3312 percent of the positions being tested each year employee testingcategory ii category ii whenever an employee has an onthejob accident or suffers an occupational onthejob injury requiring immediate treatment by a doctor or absence from work or causes an injury to a fellow employee or to the general public which requires treatment by a doctor or absence from work or where the injury was due to the employees failure to wear required personal protective equipment or where the property damage of said accident is estimated at greater than five hundred dollars $50000 said employee shall be required to participate in a substance abuse screening test for purposes of this section the term injury shall not include minor injuries such as bee stings bruises muscle strains minor cuts scrapes etc employee testingcategory iii a category iii an employee shall be required to participate in a substance abuse screening test whenever there exists reasonable cause or suspicion to believe that the employees fitness for duty is impaired by substance abuse based upon the following criteria 1 an observable workrelated behavior or similar pattern of conduct that appears to be abnormal erratic or otherwise not in conformance with acceptable city policy  2 an observable workrelated behavior or similar pattern of conduct that indicates signs of impairment of normal sensory andor motor body functions  3 any articulable facts or evidence that indicate any possible substance abuse on the job  4 any information or evidence that warrants or emanates from an authorized investigation of possible drug or alcohol related activity by a specific individual or group  5 any pattern of behavior conduct or activity that is alcohol andor drug related that is violative of municipal state or federal law 6 any employee who tests positive during a drug screening required by any licensing or certification requirement provided however if the drug screen required for the license or certification was conducted or paid for by the city said results shall be sent to the medical review offices for confirmation and the employee shall be subject to the provisions of without the necessity of additional initial screening b such information shall be reviewed by the office of the city attorney and approved as to reasonable cause or suspicion prior to a testing order employee testingcategory iv a category iv whenever any employee voluntarily enrolls in and successfully completes a certified program of substance abuse counseling or rehabilitation which is in conformance with standards normally accepted within the healthcare industry as a condition of continued employment said employee must agree in writing to remain alcohol and drug free and to undergo unannounced posttreatment substance abuse screening for a period of twentyfour 24 months from the date of reentry into active work status with the city b in order to claim the benefits of a an employee must notify his department head and enroll in the certified substance abuse counseling andor rehabilitation program prior to being selected chosen ordered or scheduled for a substance abuse screening article 3  drug screening procedure testing method a alcohol 1 testing for alcohol shall be by those methods and recognized by the state of louisiana for cases concerning driving while intoxicated such test may be conducted by 1 the laboratory selected under herein 2 the medical review officer selected under herein  or by the monroe police department 2 the cutoff limit for alcohol shall be 01% or more by weight based on grams of alcohol per one hundred 100 cubic centimeters of blood b drugs 1 testing for prohibited drugs shall be by immunoassay screen with confirmation of positive tests by gas chromatographymass spectrometry gcms techniques 2 all drug testing procedures shall conform to applicable state and federal regulations and laws the cutoff limits for drug screening shall be in accordance with nida guidelines except that the initial testing for marijuana shall be fifty 50 nanograms 3 drug testing shall be for any or all unauthorized controlled substances but shall include the following classes of drugs marijuana opiods cocaine amphetamines and phencyclidine c all testing procedures shall conform to applicable state and federal regulations and laws certified laboratories for drug testing the mayor shall determine the appropriate laboratory to perform the substance abuse screening test subject to the following criteria a the laboratory shall be certified by the national institute on drug abuse nida or by the college of american pathologists for forensic urine drug testing capfudt  b the laboratory uses nida guidelines for the collection storage and transportation of the samples  c the laboratory follows the strict guidelines of louisiana rs  et seq public employees drug testing act including but not limited to the collection storage chain of custody procedures review of results and reports of results  d the laboratory guarantees a minimum confidence level of ninetyfive 95 percent by which is meant no false positive results and less than five 5 percent false negative results  e the laboratory maintains strict confidentiality of all sample results so that at no time will the laboratory release results from any substance abuse test to anyone except as authorized herein collection procedure for urine drug specimens a all collections of urine specimens for drug testing shall be collected stored and transported in compliance with nida guidelines or pursuant to statutory or regulatory authority granted under louisiana rs  et seq  et seq andor  et seq b 1 all collection of urine specimens shall be collected with regard to the privacy of the individual 2 direct observation of the individual during collection of the urine specimen will be required under any of the following conditions a there is reason to believe that the individual may alter or substitute the specimen to be provided b the individual has provided a urine specimen that falls outside of the acceptable temperature range as listed in the nida guidelines c the last urine specimen provided by the individual was verified by the medical review officer as being adulterated based upon determinations of the laboratory d the collection site person observes conduct indicating an attempt to substitute or adulterate the sample e the individual has previously been determined to have urine specimen positive for one or more of the drugs the testing of which is regulated by this appendix and is being tested for purposes of followup testing or after return to service f the type of drug testing is postaccident or reasonable suspicioncause 3 a designated representative of the city shall review and concur in advance with any decision by a collection site person to obtain a specimen under direct observation all direct observation shall be conducted by a same gender collection site person c every collection site person shall be responsible for sanitary collection of urine specimens while maintaining privacy security and the chain of custody every collection site person shall be responsible for the proper disposal of biohazardous waste and dispose of all biohazardous waste in accordance with proper safety procedures d the collection site person shall collect split samples according to the following 1 the donor shall urinate into a collection container which the collection site person in the presence of the donor after the initial examination pours into two 2 specimen bottles both specimen bottles shall be properly sealed and labeled in the presence of the donor 2 the first bottle is to be used for the city mandated test and at a minimum shall contain the quantity specified by the nida guidelines if there is no additional urine available for the second specimen bottle the first specimen shall nevertheless be processed for testing 3 up to sixty 60 ml of the remainder of the urine shall be poured in the second specimen bottle 4 all requirements of this appendix shall be followed with respect to both samples including the requirement that a copy of the chain of custody form accompany each bottle processed under split sample procedures 5 the first sample of the split sample collection shall be tested by the laboratory selected under the provisions of above in compliance with the nida guidelines for initial and confirmatory testing in compliance with the regulations of this appendix louisiana rs  et seq  et seq and  et seq 6 the second sample shall be stored for future use or used for testing for drugs not listed in the regulations of this appendix any specimen collected under split sample procedures must be stored in a secured refrigerated environment and an appropriate entry made in the chain of custody form 7 if the test of the first bottle is confirmed as positive and a split sample is collected the employee may request that the medical review officer direct that the second bottle be tested at the employees own expense in a nidacertified or capfundtcertified laboratory for the presence of the drugss for which a positive result was obtained in the test of the first bottle the result of this test is transmitted to the medical review officer who shall honor such a request if made within seventytwo 72 hours of the employees having actual notice that he or she tested positive 8 action taken by the city as the result of a positive drug test such as removal from performing a safetysensitive function category i shall not be stayed pending the result of the second test 9 if the result of the second test is negative the medical review officer shall cancel the positive results of the first test and the employee shall be restored to his or her previous position e all samples collected for drug testing shall be packaged sealed labeled and transported with the proper chain of custody procedures for analysis to an nidacertified or capfundtcertified laboratory in strict accordance with the nida guidelines f the collection site person shall provide a written form and the opportunity for the individual to provide notification of any information which he or she considers relevant to the test including identification of currently or recently used prescription or nonprescription drugs or other relevant medical information a copy of such information shall be attached to each chain of custody form appointments for preemployment drug screening a all applicants for employment with the city shall be advised that the city requires preemployment substance abuse screening test prior to receiving an application form upon the completion of and the return of the application form to the personnel office the personnel office shall make an appointment with the laboratory for the applicant to submit a urine specimen for the drug screening test and shall make an appointment for the alcohol test prior to processing said application for an employment position b the applicant shall submit picture identification to the laboratory to verify his or her identity at the time the specimen is collected c any applicant who attempts to evade the screening process shall not be considered for employment by the city for a period of twelve 12 months appointments for employee drug screening a each department head shall be responsible for arranging and transporting employees under his supervision to and from 1 the site for alcohol testing and 2 the laboratory for collection of urine specimens in the event of a category ii test in which the employee is unable to be transported to the laboratory within a reasonable time due to injuries received the department head shall make arrangements to have personnel from the laboratory come to the employee to take the specimen b the identity of the employee participating in the screening procedure shall be verified by picture identification if circumstances make such identification too onerous or impractical the employees identity may be confirmed by the department head or his designated representative c any employee who attempts to evade the drug screening process shall be dismissed from employment with the city and shall not be considered for future employment by the city for a period of twelve 12 months article 4  review of test results medical review officer the mayor shall select a medical review officer who shall be a licensed physician responsible for receiving laboratory results generated by the drug testing procedure who has knowledge of substance abuse disorders and has appropriate medical training to interpret and evaluate an individuals positive test result together with his medical history and any other relevant biomedical information review of drug testing results a all positive results from drug testing except preemployment testing shall be reported directly to the medical review officer as provided in this appendix b positive results on preemployment drug testing may be reviewed by the medical review officer if the city chooses not to confirm a positive test result of a preemployment drug screen test the city shall notify the applicant of the positive result and shall offer the applicant the opportunity to pay for a confirmation of the test and a review of that confirmation by the medical review officer negative results need not be reviewed by the medical review officer and shall be reported to the appropriate representative of the city c the medical review officer shall review all confirmed positive drug testing results of employees and report such results to the city in compliance with nida guidelines or pursuant to the authority granted under louisiana rs  et seq and  et seq negative results need not be reviewed by the medical review officer and shall be reported to the appropriate representative of the city d adulterated specimens shall be reported as such to the medical review officer with clarification as to the specific nature or the adulteration the medical review officer shall contact the individual who submitted the specimen as outlined in the nida guidelines before making a final decision to verify a positive report of an adulteration  rights of the employee any employee confirmed positive upon his written request shall have the right of access within seven 7 working days to records relating to his drug tests and any records relating to the results of any relevant certification review or suspensionrevocationofcertification proceedings article 5  effect of positive results applicants for employment any applicant for employment who tests positive for alcohol or other unauthorized substances under the above procedures shall not be employed by the city and shall not be considered for employment for a period of twelve 12 months employees a any employee who tests positive for alcohol or other unauthorized substance under the above procedures shall be dismissed from city employment and shall not be considered for future employment for a period of at least twelve 12 months and only then after satisfying the requirements of a b any employee who uses possesses conceals transports manufactures distributes dispenses solicits sells or purchases any unauthorized alcohol or other unauthorized substance on city premises or while on city time shall be dismissed from his or her employment with the city and shall not be considered for future employment by the city for a period of twelve 12 months code comparative table 1958 code this table gives the location within this those sections of the 1958 updated which are included herein
